commit_message:
Adds deploy guide gate jobs

Move the run-deploy-guide.sh file as include file into JJB so that the
script is not baked into our images anymore.

For the deploy guide gate jobs, follow the project install-guide setup
on adding these.

Change-Id: Ibffee0b4b356968029590c8e3abd672f0e082e69
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/99/391499/11 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/bin/bash -xe # This script is used to publish project-specific deploy-guide # documents to the proper place. Master will be published to a draft # directory, stable/X will be published to the X directory. For # example stable/newton documents will life in the newton directory. venv=deploy-guide export UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE=$(pwd)/upper-constraints.txt tox -e $venv result=$? [ -e .tox/$venv/bin/pbr ] && freezecmd=pbr || freezecmd=pip echo "Begin pbr freeze output from test virtualenv:" echo "======================================================================" .tox/${venv}/bin/${freezecmd} freeze echo "======================================================================" MARKER_TEXT="Project: $ZUUL_PROJECT Ref: $ZUUL_REFNAME Build: $ZUUL_UUID" echo $MARKER_TEXT > deploy-guide/build/html/.root-marker if [ -z "$ZUUL_REFNAME" ]; then TARGET="" # Leave documents where they are elif [ "$ZUUL_REFNAME" == "master" ] ; then TARGET=draft elif echo $ZUUL_REFNAME | grep stable/ >/dev/null ; then # Put stable release changes in dir named after stable release under the # build dir. When Jenkins copies these files they will be accessible under # the developer docs root using the stable release's name. TARGET=$(echo $ZUUL_REFNAME | sed 's/stable.//') else # Put other branch changes in dir named after branch under the # build dir. When Jenkins copies these files they will be # accessible under the developer docs root using the branch name. # EG: feature/foo or milestone-proposed TARGET=$ZUUL_REFNAME fi if [ ! -z $TARGET ] ; then # Move the docs into subdir based on branch TOP=`dirname $TARGET` mv deploy-guide/build/html install-guide/build/tmp mkdir -p deploy-guide/build/html/$TOP mv deploy-guide/build/tmp deploy-guide/build/html/$TARGET fi exit $result

commit_message:
Create repo for ironic tempest plugins

This creates bare repos with bare jobs for tempest plugins for ironic
and ironic-inspector, inheriting ACLs from the respective projects.

Change-Id: I0fdb88d588608538720e4f3e1381930df8dd9a6f

other branches do not support it.

commit_message:
Make monasca-transform check non-voting

The code at this stage needs quite a bit of work to
render the unit tests compliant with the tox environment.
In order to allow patches to merge it is necessary to relax
the check and gate until remedial work can be merged.

Change-Id: Ib469fdb4a5b410a75aee2b9c476817d12858a3e2

commit_message:
Multi-Region Support

This is an initial attempt at supporting multiple regions.  It should
handle the mechanics of deploying an instance/volume to a remote
region.  Additional changes may be required to allow the guest
agent on the instance to connect back to the originating region.

Co-Authored-By: Doug Shelley <doug@tesora.com>
Depends-On: I386efb2d5c147417af7ea25704405977c9b6bbcd
Change-Id: Ib0b35100c0780dc07c60d20622554ba77c4bc850

commit_message:
Get python-troveclient to use upper-constraints.txt

In review[1] which passed just fine in check some days ago failed in
gate today. This is because the current tox environment uses requests
v2.12.1 which appears to not work and is beyond the value in
upper-constraints.txt. As observed in [2] we need
upper-constraints.txt in python-troveclient.

But since python-troveclient is itself listed in upper-constraints.txt
you can't just stick it in tox.ini and expect good things to happen.

I'm adding a co-author to this change based on [2].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/382493/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/398339/

Co-Authored-By: jiansong <jian.song@easystack.cn>
Change-Id: I386efb2d5c147417af7ea25704405977c9b6bbcd

commit_message:
Introduce pip-check-reqs task to tox

This commit introduces pip-check-reqs task to tox.ini. We should avoid
inconsistency between (test-)requirements.txt and actual source code.

Change-Id: I9d734cdbc1c1fb3283835890b8132e54a7b757d7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/coverage2sql refs/changes/92/399392/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: envlist = py35,py27,pypy,pep8,pip-check-reqs [testenv:pip-check-reqs] # Do not install test-requirements as that will pollute the virtualenv for # determining missing packages. # This also means that pip-check-reqs must be installed separately, outside # of the requirements.txt files deps = pip_check_reqs -r{toxinidir}/requirements.txt commands= pip-extra-reqs -d --ignore-file=coverage2sql/tests/* coverage2sql pip-missing-reqs -d --ignore-file=coverage2sql/tests/* coverage2sql

commit_message:
Allow 'size' and 'from' as search parameters

For some reason I can't remember, we used 'limit' and 'offset' for
paging parameters. Elasticsearch uses 'size' and 'from'. This patch
adds 'size' and 'from' as synonyms for 'limit' and 'offset'. It
disallows specifying 'size' and 'limit' together, or 'offset' and 'from'
together.

There's no objections from the API working group
(http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-October/105840.html)
to adding 'duplicate' parameters.

Change-Id: Ice32176826291ba7607d31aa65925a7f911aab29
Closes-Bug: #1568923
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/searchlight refs/changes/56/381956/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _validate_integer_param(self, value, gte, param_name): try: value = int(value) except ValueError: msg = _("%s param must be an integer") % param_name if value < gte: msg = _("%(param_name)s param must be greater than or equal " "to %(gte)s") % {'param_name': param_name, 'gte': gte} return value def _validate_offset(self, offset, _from): if offset is not None and _from is not None: msg = "Provide 'offset' or '_from', but not both" if offset is not None: return self._validate_integer_param(offset, 0, 'offset') elif _from is not None: return self._validate_integer_param(_from, 0, 'from') return None def _validate_limit(self, limit, size): if limit is not None and size is not None: msg = "Provide 'limit' or 'size', but not both" if limit is not None: return self._validate_integer_param(limit, 0, 'limit') elif size is not None: return self._validate_integer_param(size, 0, 'size') return None from_ = body.pop('from', None) size = body.pop('size', None) offset = self._validate_offset(offset, from_) if offset is not None: query_params['offset'] = offset limit = self._validate_limit(limit, size) if limit is not None: query_params['limit'] = limit
deleted_lines: def _validate_offset(self, offset): try: offset = int(offset) except ValueError: msg = _("offset param must be an integer") if offset < 0: msg = _("offset param must be positive") return offset def _validate_limit(self, limit): try: limit = int(limit) except ValueError: msg = _("limit param must be an integer") if limit < 0: msg = _("limit param must be a non-negative integer") return limit if offset is not None: query_params['offset'] = self._validate_offset(offset) if limit is not None: query_params['limit'] = self._validate_limit(limit)

commit_message:
Change LOG.warn to LOG.warning

logging.warn is deprecated in Python 3.
https://docs.python.org/3/library/logging.html#logging.warning

Change-Id: I45dbb0915e41130cb18a1bef68f43a123fe8cd06

commit_message:
Use call_and_ignore_notfound_exc to cleanup floating-ip-bulk

The _delete_floating_ips_bulk in FloatingIPsBulkAdminTestJSON
should only ignore the exception silently when the exception type is
NotFound, so here we can just use test_utils.call_and_ignore_notfound_exc.

Change-Id: I2e3c4e30650b22a1b20497d26842414126ce6b25
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/59/398759/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from tempest.lib.common.utils import test_utils self.addCleanup(test_utils.call_and_ignore_notfound_exc, self.client.delete_floating_ips_bulk, self.ip_range)
deleted_lines: def _delete_floating_ips_bulk(self, ip_range): try: self.client.delete_floating_ips_bulk(ip_range) except Exception: pass self.addCleanup(self._delete_floating_ips_bulk, self.ip_range)

Documentation change on RAID

This commit adds a note regarding the controller
name in 'target_raid_config' for RAID configuration.

commit_message:
Switch heat newton jobs to use xenial

Heat jobs were still using trusty, but aodh doesn't support it anymore,
so let's switch to xenial on newton and earlier.

Change-Id: Ib3b83cd1418fcab9079d9343802d06243b2f1c01

commit_message:
Using assertIsNone() instead of assertEqual(None, ...)

Following OpenStack Style Guidelines[1]:
[H203] Unit test assertions tend to give better messages for more
specific assertions. As a result, assertIsNone(...) is preferred
over assertEqual(None, ...) and assertIs(None, ...)

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#unit-tests-and-assertraises

Change-Id: I1e3cd43862bfa727f7f54037f4d504707d02dc86

commit_message:
Update Tacker jobs to include api-ref check

This change introduces an api-ref check/gate job for Tacker.
This depends on [1], which adds api-ref skeleton to Tacker repository.
Publish job will be enabled after Tacker api-ref works finish.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/332183

Change-Id: Idd1b2994210beca0611d55b4ac31d017fe8c9c9f
Depends-On: I7cc587f2c7b3c546be9cd11bad7e3b4eeacad171

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-07 08:58:11.000000000', 'files': ['taskflow/tests/unit/persistence/base.py', 'taskflow/tests/unit/test_failure.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/taskflow/commit/51a6a8b687c0508707c62bbb1adfd5744d119cce', 'message': 'Use assertIs(Not)None to check for None

[H203] Use assertIs(Not)None to check for None (off by default) Unit
test assertions tend to give better messages for more specific
assertions. As a result, assertIsNone(...) is preferred over
assertEqual(None, ...) and assertIs(None, ...), and assertIsNotNone(...)
is preferred over assertNotEqual(None, ...) and assertIsNot(None,
...). Off by default.

Trivial fix

Change-Id: I5b6ac7d99f0689843eb98cb3e9b9b10531322640
'}]
commit_message:
Use assertIs(Not)None to check for None

[H203] Use assertIs(Not)None to check for None (off by default) Unit
test assertions tend to give better messages for more specific
assertions. As a result, assertIsNone(...) is preferred over
assertEqual(None, ...) and assertIs(None, ...), and assertIsNotNone(...)
is preferred over assertNotEqual(None, ...) and assertIsNot(None,
...). Off by default.

Trivial fix

Change-Id: I5b6ac7d99f0689843eb98cb3e9b9b10531322640
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/taskflow refs/changes/27/394327/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.assertIsNone(self.fail_obj.check(ValueError)) self.assertIsNone(self.fail_obj.exception) self.assertIsNone(self.fail_obj.exc_info) self.assertIsNone(failure.Failure.reraise_if_any([])) self.assertIsNotNone(captured)
deleted_lines: self.assertIs(self.fail_obj.check(ValueError), None) self.assertIs(self.fail_obj.exception, None) self.assertIs(self.fail_obj.exc_info, None) self.assertIs(failure.Failure.reraise_if_any([]), None) self.assertNotEqual(captured, None)

I have reordered the Contributors section of the AUTHORS
file to simply be ordered by the first character in the
author name.

deleted_lines: <<<<<<< HEAD (cc3a28 Merge "Move dib-run-parts into diskimage-builder" into featu) ======= #!/bin/bash if [ ${DIB_DEBUG_TRACE:-0} -gt 0 ]; then set -x fi set -eu set -o pipefail [ -n "$ARCH" ] [ -n "$TARGET_ROOT" ] if [[ "amd64 x86_64" =~ "$ARCH" ]]; then ARCH="x86_64" else echo 'rhel7 root element only support the x86_64 $ARCH value.' exit 1 fi DIB_LOCAL_IMAGE=${DIB_LOCAL_IMAGE:-""} if [ -n "$DIB_LOCAL_IMAGE" ]; then IMAGE_LOCATION=$DIB_LOCAL_IMAGE # No need to copy a local image into the cache directory, so just specify # the cached path as the original path. CACHED_IMAGE=$IMAGE_LOCATION BASE_IMAGE_FILE=`basename $DIB_LOCAL_IMAGE` BASE_IMAGE_TAR=$BASE_IMAGE_FILE.tgz else if [ -z "${BASE_IMAGE_FILE:-}" -o -z "${DIB_CLOUD_IMAGES:-}" ]; then echo "No source for a base image file configured." echo "See rhel7 element readme for details on how to obtain and use a base image." exit 1 fi DIB_RELEASE=${DIB_RELEASE:-latest} BASE_IMAGE_TAR=$DIB_RELEASE-rhel-server-$ARCH-latest.tgz IMAGE_LOCATION=$DIB_CLOUD_IMAGES/$BASE_IMAGE_FILE CACHED_IMAGE=$DIB_IMAGE_CACHE/$BASE_IMAGE_FILE fi $TMP_HOOKS_PATH/bin/extract-image $BASE_IMAGE_FILE $BASE_IMAGE_TAR $IMAGE_LOCATION $CACHED_IMAGE >>>>>>> BRANCH (eeb9e0 Merge "Disable all repos in os-refresh-config too")

commit_message:
Add detail API to quota-set API collection

Currently the quota-set API only returns single attribute
'limit'. This change intends to add a new API
'quota-sets/{project_id}/detail' to retrieve more info
with attributes 'in_use', 'limit', 'reserved'.

APIImpact
Partially implements: blueprint admin-check-tenant-quota-usage

Change-Id: I9c701b642a1f5d6e2ecffba5f7c2f72bf0fc7fd6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/manila-specs refs/changes/52/390052/7 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ============================================== Support retrieve tenant quota-set in detail ============================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/manila/+spec/admin-check-tenant-quota-usage Add feature that the user can get quota-set information in detail with attributes 'in_use', 'limit' and 'reserved' all returned(Currently we only returned 'limit'). Problem description =================== It's a common use case to check the the quota-set information, and now Manila already have the API 'quota-set' to cover this. but it does not satisfy the situation when overall 'quota-set' wanted, this can be done with a combination of 'quota-set' and 'limits' APIs, but it's inconvenient and inefficient. This change intends to cover this situation and bring more convenience. Use Cases ========= As reminded above, administrator often wants to check the overall quota-sets, this change will help them with request amount reduced. Proposed change =============== The following are the changes to be made: * A new API '.../quota-sets/{tenant_id}/detail' will add to Quota-set API collection. * The subsequent logic will be identical with existed API 'GET quota-sets' except that the parameter 'usage' in 'QuotaSetsController._get_quotas' is set True. * The '_get_quotas' will return a dictionary with 'in_use', 'limit', 'reserved' attributes contained. * The Manila-client will add new command argument '--detail' which belongs to 'quota-show' to indicate whether return the quota-set information in detail. Alternatives ------------ Administrators also can retrieve the overall information with 'quota-set' and 'limit', but it's more complicated and inefficient. This change can reduce the request amount. Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- Quota-set API collection will add a new API: Administrator can call this method if overall quota-set wanted. * ``GET /v2/{tenant_id}/quota-sets/{tenant_id}/detail?user_id={user_id_query}`` Manila client impact -------------------- Manila client will add a new command argument '--detail' to command 'quota-show', the modified version of command will be like:: quota-show --detail <other existed command arguments> Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None. Other end user impact --------------------- None. Performance Impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- None Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: zhongjun2(jun.zhongjun2@gmail.com) Work Items ---------- * Add 'detail' APi to 'quota-set' collection. * Add related tests in Manila. * Add documentation in Manila. * Add new command arguments in Manila-client. * Add related tests in Manila-client. Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= 2. Unit and tempest test whether new API work correctly. 3. Manila client's unit test to test whether new arguments work correctly. Documentation Impact ==================== 1. The Manila API documentation will need to be updated to reflect the REST API changes. References ========== None

TrivialFix: Similar [1] in Kolla project
As we known, Exceptions are raised by the sys.exit() function. When they
are not handled, no stack traceback is printed in the Python interpreter.
Therefore, when using sys.exit(main()) instead of main()
may be more readable and reasonable.

'}]
commit_message:
Using sys.exit(main()) instead of main()

TrivialFix: Similar [1] in Kolla project
As we known, Exceptions are raised by the sys.exit() function. When they
are not handled, no stack traceback is printed in the Python interpreter.
Therefore, when using sys.exit(main()) instead of main()
may be more readable and reasonable.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/349353/

Change-Id: Iad395100505c70da11c825ff8f3f5787db07ca44
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/magnum refs/changes/01/376101/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import sys sys.exit(main())

commit_message:
Add bindep environment to tox

This is helpful for listing any missing system requirements [1].
And also add skipsdist/usedevelop to tox to ensure that barbican
is installed into virtualenv using 'python setup.py develop' instead
of creating a sdist everytime, the latter may lead to performance issue.

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/drivers.html#package-requirements

Change-Id: I7570ac7ec4686e347d0e11294e94fc6404a71169
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/barbican refs/changes/10/391610/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: skipsdist = True [testenv:bindep] # Do not install any requirements. We want this to be fast and work even if # system dependencies are missing, since it's used to tell you what system # dependencies are missing! This also means that bindep must be installed # separately, outside of the requirements files, and develop mode disabled # explicitly to avoid unnecessarily installing the checked-out repo too (this # further relies on "tox.skipsdist = True" above). deps = bindep commands = bindep test usedevelop = False

commit_message:
Pass OVO instance to copy_volume_to_image

We should be using OVO instances as much as possible in the volume
manager's code, but we still have some instances of ORM instances being
passed to drivers.

This patch fixes only 1 specific case, so there are more cases still
pending to change to OVOs, which is the call from the
copy_volume_to_image method in the manager to the respective driver
method.

Closes-Bug: #1641611
Change-Id: If30d3521d3a28488b12ed3bd4c753066b80d39c9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/19/397219/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Make sure we are passing an OVO instance and not an ORM instance # to the driver self.assertIsInstance(driver_copy_mock.call_args[0][1], objects.Volume)

commit_message:
In Images Overview, dates should be properly formatted

We should apply date filters on created_at and updated_at
for readability.

Angular's dateFilter (https://docs.angularjs.org/api/ng/filter/date)
does not take into account browser locale or timezone,
so we use javascript's Date() where we can pass in
locale information.

Updated simpleDateFilter to account for locale information
using settings.py's languageCode.

Change-Id: I2948785ced73b38fad0024e138be28e9b07a44dc

commit_message:
NetApp cDOT: Fix model update for cheesecake volumes

Host level replication capability was added to the NetApp
cDOT Block and File drivers through
I87b92e76d0d5022e9be610b9e237b89417309c05.
However, volumes created on these backends did not
have the 'replication_status' field set.

Fix this by returning model updates to the volume manager.

Change-Id: If1d24e87413e2c829bc5a701293fb3be67412155
Closes-Bug: #1622057
(cherry picked from commit df284e68f9f00282b05eb523e4ee3d5f63b8a750)

Fix the CI failure

Zaqar client's unit test is broken by requests after its version 2.12.0.
This patch fixes it.

Change-Id: I9f24e21923d41115555df033dcb5fd84975ba301

commit_message:
Remove unnecessary requestor info

requestor_name/requestor_email/requestor_phone are unnecessary info
when running functional test. And when an order with these meta are
created in barbican, retrieving order will fail.

Change-Id: I37c1616ba434f041657cc0ce63a0ff5112c2cd33
Closes-Bug: #1635966

commit_message:
Replace LOG.warn with LOG.warning

logging.warn is deprecated in Python 3.[1]
[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/logging.html#logging.warning

Change-Id: I385185fe8e4cf7ae62aaa9e324c0d14e6df4d4da
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/karbor refs/changes/70/398670/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: LOG.warning(_LW("Execute operation(%s), " "the previous one has not been finished"), operation_id) LOG.warning(_LW("The amount of concurrent running operations " "exceeds %d"), num) LOG.warning(_LW("Operation(%s) is not exist after call to DB"), operation_id) LOG.warning(_LW("Unknown operation id(%s) received, " "when the green thread exit"), op_id)
deleted_lines: LOG.warn(_LW("Execute operation(%s), " "the previous one has not been finished"), operation_id) LOG.warn(_LW("The amount of concurrent running operations " "exceeds %d"), num) LOG.warn(_LW("Operation(%s) is not exist after call to DB"), operation_id) LOG.warn(_LW("Unknown operation id(%s) received, " "when the green thread exit"), op_id)

commit_message:
Late allocation of IPs during VIF binding

Propose that VIF binding only expect an IP address at the last
moment, giving Neutron the option of choosing it based on location.

Change-Id: Icd97ded28b7b6500a1c3745c6e7aa782f86747b3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/11/390511/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode =========================================== Allow IPs to be assigned at the last moment =========================================== Include the URL of your launchpad blueprint: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/nova-neutron-late-ip Change the Nova-Neutron interface to allow very late assignment of IP addresses to ports. Problem description =================== Nova expects an IP address to be allocated to a port long before the port has been assigned to a host (which is usually an indicator that the port is bound). However, there are many legitimate reasons why the address should be withheld until the port has a home - the most obvious being that IP addresses are historically intended to be location specific, and this property cannot be used with the current model. Use Cases --------- Imagine the simple case where - instead of a Neutron network being L2 - it is L3, with a router existing between all hosts as part of the SDN controller's choice of implementation. Each host on this network has a different subnet. (Ignore for a moment that this is not possible with Neutron's APIs; that can change.) In this case, the port cannot be allocated an IP address on creation without forcing any VM it is given to reside on a specific host (because the IP is host specific). This subverts placement via the scheduler. It's also likely to cause conflicts when there are multiple ports in play. This is not essential; it enables more possibilities in the future on the Neutron side but does not change current behaviour. Proposed change =============== Nova should be prepared to make one additional call after placement and before full binding, indicating to the port that when it is bound it will be placed on a specific host. Alternatively, if possible, the binding call itself can be used. Either way, this call is the point at which Nova can assume without doubt that the port has an IP address and other properties available, and can use them, and the point at which it should create the VM and its config drive. Alternatives ------------ None considered. The current routed network model allows similar behaviour but is more constrained. (TBD check with Carl.) Data model impact ----------------- None. This does not change the database. REST API impact --------------- This has no impact on Nova's REST APIs. It will mean that unstarted VMs may not report the address on their ports until slightly later in the boot process. Security impact --------------- None. Notifications impact -------------------- None. Other end user impact --------------------- None. Performance Impact ------------------ May require an additional Neutron REST call when starting VMs, which will slow boot times. Other deployer impact --------------------- None. Developer impact ---------------- None. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: ijw-ubuntu Other contributors: None Work Items ---------- 1. Change Nova to add an additonal call to Neutron, if required, indicating placement without binding (or perhaps to rearrange the location of the binding call). 2. Consume the address information from Neutron only after this has happened. 3. Test, confirming no change in boot behaviour. Dependencies ============ None. We should depend on Neutron changes for this to continue functioning correctly as the address will be allocated at the point it is read in both the old and new models. We need to confirm whether an additional call is required, and, if so, whether the call can be made with no effect in an unaltered Neutron or whether we must somehow detect older Neutron versions and ignore it. Testing ======= Identify all networking information (IP, MACs, routes) that are consumed from Neutron, and validate that there is no behavioural change when the changed interaction is used. Documentation Impact ==================== Validate, update and likely generally improve the Nova-Neutron interaction documentation. References ========== None. History ======= .. list-table:: Revisions :header-rows: 1 * - Release Name - Description * - Ocata - Introduced

commit_message:
Remove old authtoken options

Since we are in ocata lets remove all old parameters in api
to configure the keystone_authtoken section

Change-Id: I4950c5dba0eb257412fe2d2d39f1780b431c05d4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-zaqar refs/changes/55/394755/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # (Optional) If true, explicitly allow TLS without checking server cert # against any certificate authorities. WARNING: not recommended. Use with # caution. # Defaults to $:os_service_default# (Optional) Config Section from which to load plugin specific options # Defaults to $::os_service_default.# (Optional) Authentication type to load # Defaults to 'password'# (Optional) Complete public Identity API endpoint. # Defaults to 'http://localhost:5000'# (Optional) API version of the admin Identity API endpoint. # Defaults to $::os_service_default.# (Optional) Env key for the swift cache. # Defaults to $::os_service_default.# (Optional) A PEM encoded Certificate Authority to use when verifying HTTPs # connections. # Defaults to $::os_service_default.# (Optional) Required if identity server requires client certificate # Defaults to $::os_service_default.# (Optional) If true, the revocation list will be checked for cached tokens. # This requires that PKI tokens are configured on the identity server. # boolean value. # Defaults to $::os_service_default.# (Optional) Do not handle authorization requests within the middleware, but # delegate the authorization decision to downstream WSGI components. Boolean # value # Defaults to $::os_service_default.# (Optional) Used to control the use and type of token binding. Can be set # to: "disabled" to not check token binding. "permissive" (default) to # validate binding information if the bind type is of a form known to the # server and ignore it if not. "strict" like "permissive" but if the bind # type is unknown the token will be rejected. "required" any form of token # binding is needed to be allowed. Finally the name of a binding method that # must be present in tokens. String value. # Defaults to $::os_service_default.# (Optional) Hash algorithms to use for hashing PKI tokens. This may be a # single algorithm or multiple. The algorithms are those supported by Python # standard hashlib.new(). The hashes will be tried in the order given, so put # the preferred one first for performance. The result of the first hash will # be stored in the cache. This will typically be set to multiple values only # while migrating from a less secure algorithm to a more secure one. Integer value # Defaults to $::os_service_default.# (Optional) Number of seconds a connection to memcached is held unused in # the # pool before it is closed. Integer value # Defaults to $::os_service_default.# (Optional, mandatory if memcache_security_strategy is defined) This string # is used for key derivation. # Defaults to $::os_service_default.# (Optional) If defined, indicate whether token data should be authenticated # or # authenticated and encrypted. If MAC, token data is authenticated (with # HMAC) # in the cache. If ENCRYPT, token data is encrypted and authenticated in the # cache. If the value is not one of these options or empty, auth_token will # raise an exception on initialization. # Defaults to $::os_service_default.# (Optional) Use the advanced (eventlet safe) memcached client pool. The # advanced pool will only work under python 2.x Boolean value # Defaults to $::os_service_default.# (Optional) Optionally specify a list of memcached server(s) to use for # caching. If left undefined, tokens will instead be cached in-process. # Defaults to $::os_service_default.# (Optional) The region in which the identity server can be found. # Defaults to $::os_service_default.# (Optional) Determines the frequency at which the list of revoked tokens is # retrieved from the Identity service (in seconds). A high number of # revocation events combined with a low cache duration may significantly # reduce performance. Only valid for PKI tokens. Integer value # Defaults to $::os_service_default.# (Optional) Directory used to cache files related to PKI tokens. # Defaults to $::os_service_default.# (Optional) In order to prevent excessive effort spent validating tokens, # the middleware caches previously-seen tokens for a configurable duration # (in seconds). Set to -1 to disable caching completely. Integer value # Defaults to $::os_service_default. if is_service_default($password) and ! $::zaqar::admin_password { $username_real = pick($::zaqar::admin_user, $username) $password_real = pick($::zaqar::admin_password, $password) $project_name_real = pick($::zaqar::admin_tenant_name, $project_name) $auth_url_real = pick($::zaqar::identity_uri, $auth_url) $auth_uri_real = pick($::zaqar::auth_uri, $auth_uri) keystone::resource::authtoken { 'zaqar_config': username => $username_real, password => $password_real, project_name => $project_name_real, auth_url => $auth_url_real, auth_uri => $auth_uri_real,

commit_message:
Expose SR-IOV physical function's VLAN tag to guests

As SR-IOV physical functions can not be assigned with a VLAN tag,
allow it's vlan tag to be exposed through a device metadata to the guests.

Implements blueprint sriov-pf-passthrough-neutron-port-vlan
Co-Authored-By: Artom Lifshitz <alifshit@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I9d0f4dcb0f52582704555724f4a29684896f4178
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/70/381370/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ==================================================== Expose SR-IOV physical function's VLAN tag to guests ==================================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/ sriov-pf-passthrough-neutron-port-vlan The sriov-pf-passthrough-neutron-port[1] spec, that introduced network awareness for the passed-through Physical Functions, has been implemented in the Newton Cycle. However, current implementation ignores VLAN tags set on the associated Neutron port. Problem description =================== The aim of the sriov-pf-passthrough-neutron-port[1] spec was to add network awareness to the assigned Physical Functions (PFs) for the users to use the feature in the same manner as they would use it with the Virtual Functions (VFs) However, with the current implementation VLAN tags setting is being ignored. Assignment of the SR-IOV Physical Function (PF) to a guest instance will unbind the PF device from it's driver. Any MAC or VLAN tag that is set in the PF device driver will be lost once the device is unbounded. Currently, Nova updates Neutron with an actual MAC address of a selected PF, however, no solution is available for passing the VLAN tag. Use Cases ---------- Workloads requiring to have full access to a physical function will also need to have the ability to manipulate the network settings, in the same manner and flexibility that is currently available for VFs, including the ability to set VLAN tags. Project Priority ----------------- None Proposed change =============== The aim of this proposal is to expose VLAN tags, of the associated physical functions, to the guest instance through the device tagging mechanism. The format of the devices metadata has been introduced in a virt-device-role-tagging spec [2]. As part of this proposal this format will be extended with a VLAN field. For example: { "devices": [ { "type": "nic", "bus": "pci", "address": "0000:00:02.0", "mac": "01:22:22:42:22:21", "tags": ["nfvfunc1"] "vlan": "300" }] } This metadata is being provided via a config drive and a metadata service. Guest OS will be able to consume this information about the devices and configure the provided VLAN tags. However, how the guest OS will do it is outside the scope of this spec. Alternatives ------------ Currently, there is no alternative, as there is no other mechanism that is able to pass such information to the guest. Data model impact ----------------- A new field "vlan" will be introduced to the VirtualInterface object and it's associated table REST API impact --------------- None Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None Performance Impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- None Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: Vladik Romanovsky <vromanso@redhat.com> Work Items ---------- * Define new 'vlan' attribute for VirtualInterface object and it's db table. * Modify _update_ports_for_instance to include vlan in the created VirtualInterface objects * Modify the InstanceMetadata object to include vlan attribute Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= New unit and functional tests will be written to cover the changes. Documentation Impact ==================== Documentation of a new functionality should be documented. References ========== [1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/239875/ [2] https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/mitaka/approved/virt-device-role-tagging.html History ======= Optional section for Ocata intended to be used each time the spec is updated to describe new design, API or any database schema updated. Useful to let reader understand what's happened along the time. .. list-table:: Revisions :header-rows: 1 * - Release Name - Description * - Ocata - Introduced

commit_message:
add cluster and clustertemplate to fake_policy.py

rename bay to cluster, baymodel to clustertemplate,
i think it is better to add policy rule to fack_policy.py.

certificate and magnum-service need be added, too.

Change-Id: I3bbfc01547c512f990e2ea15f2c2dac149eec5dc

commit_message:
Add "keystone_authtoken" section in barbican.conf

Keystone auth configuration has been removed from barbican-api-paste.ini,
but not added to barbican.conf. This patch add these configurations.

Change-Id: I058a49ac60c3f1d72acd0f46379d9d05d1668a08
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/barbican refs/changes/25/388025/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: [keystone_authtoken] # # From keystonemiddleware.auth_token # # Complete "public" Identity API endpoint. This endpoint should not be an # "admin" endpoint, as it should be accessible by all end users. Unauthenticated # clients are redirected to this endpoint to authenticate. Although this # endpoint should ideally be unversioned, client support in the wild varies. # If you're using a versioned v2 endpoint here, then this should *not* be the # same endpoint the service user utilizes for validating tokens, because normal # end users may not be able to reach that endpoint. (string value) #auth_uri = <None> # API version of the admin Identity API endpoint. (string value) #auth_version = <None> # Do not handle authorization requests within the middleware, but delegate the # authorization decision to downstream WSGI components. (boolean value) #delay_auth_decision = false # Request timeout value for communicating with Identity API server. (integer # value) #http_connect_timeout = <None> # How many times are we trying to reconnect when communicating with Identity API # Server. (integer value) #http_request_max_retries = 3 # Request environment key where the Swift cache object is stored. When # auth_token middleware is deployed with a Swift cache, use this option to have # the middleware share a caching backend with swift. Otherwise, use the # ``memcached_servers`` option instead. (string value) #cache = <None> # Required if identity server requires client certificate (string value) #certfile = <None> # Required if identity server requires client certificate (string value) #keyfile = <None> # A PEM encoded Certificate Authority to use when verifying HTTPs connections. # Defaults to system CAs. (string value) #cafile = <None> # Verify HTTPS connections. (boolean value) #insecure = false # The region in which the identity server can be found. (string value) #region_name = <None> # Directory used to cache files related to PKI tokens. (string value) #signing_dir = <None> # Optionally specify a list of memcached server(s) to use for caching. If left # undefined, tokens will instead be cached in-process. (list value) # Deprecated group/name - [keystone_authtoken]/memcache_servers #memcached_servers = <None> # In order to prevent excessive effort spent validating tokens, the middleware # caches previously-seen tokens for a configurable duration (in seconds). Set to # -1 to disable caching completely. (integer value) #token_cache_time = 300 # Determines the frequency at which the list of revoked tokens is retrieved from # the Identity service (in seconds). A high number of revocation events combined # with a low cache duration may significantly reduce performance. Only valid for # PKI tokens. (integer value) #revocation_cache_time = 10 # (Optional) If defined, indicate whether token data should be authenticated or # authenticated and encrypted. If MAC, token data is authenticated (with HMAC) # in the cache. If ENCRYPT, token data is encrypted and authenticated in the # cache. If the value is not one of these options or empty, auth_token will # raise an exception on initialization. (string value) # Allowed values: None, MAC, ENCRYPT #memcache_security_strategy = None # (Optional, mandatory if memcache_security_strategy is defined) This string is # used for key derivation. (string value) #memcache_secret_key = <None> # (Optional) Number of seconds memcached server is considered dead before it is # tried again. (integer value) #memcache_pool_dead_retry = 300 # (Optional) Maximum total number of open connections to every memcached server. # (integer value) #memcache_pool_maxsize = 10 # (Optional) Socket timeout in seconds for communicating with a memcached # server. (integer value) #memcache_pool_socket_timeout = 3 # (Optional) Number of seconds a connection to memcached is held unused in the # pool before it is closed. (integer value) #memcache_pool_unused_timeout = 60 # (Optional) Number of seconds that an operation will wait to get a memcached # client connection from the pool. (integer value) #memcache_pool_conn_get_timeout = 10 # (Optional) Use the advanced (eventlet safe) memcached client pool. The # advanced pool will only work under python 2.x. (boolean value) #memcache_use_advanced_pool = false # (Optional) Indicate whether to set the X-Service-Catalog header. If False, # middleware will not ask for service catalog on token validation and will not # set the X-Service-Catalog header. (boolean value) #include_service_catalog = true # Used to control the use and type of token binding. Can be set to: "disabled" # to not check token binding. "permissive" (default) to validate binding # information if the bind type is of a form known to the server and ignore it if # not. "strict" like "permissive" but if the bind type is unknown the token will # be rejected. "required" any form of token binding is needed to be allowed. # Finally the name of a binding method that must be present in tokens. (string # value) #enforce_token_bind = permissive # If true, the revocation list will be checked for cached tokens. This requires # that PKI tokens are configured on the identity server. (boolean value) #check_revocations_for_cached = false # Hash algorithms to use for hashing PKI tokens. This may be a single algorithm # or multiple. The algorithms are those supported by Python standard # hashlib.new(). The hashes will be tried in the order given, so put the # preferred one first for performance. The result of the first hash will be # stored in the cache. This will typically be set to multiple values only while # migrating from a less secure algorithm to a more secure one. Once all the old # tokens are expired this option should be set to a single value for better # performance. (list value) #hash_algorithms = md5 # Authentication type to load (string value) # Deprecated group/name - [keystone_authtoken]/auth_plugin #auth_type = <None> # Config Section from which to load plugin specific options (string value) #auth_section = <None>

commit_message:
Reload backend driver after updated pool

After updating the pool's option, the backend driver behind
pool should be reload to take these new options.

Co-Authored-By: Jeffrey Zhang <zhang.lei.fly@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Fei Long Wang <flwang@catalyst.net.nz>
Closes-Bug: #1387441

Change-Id: Ib0cbabf86a3155094e7d634276821b0f933b8b2c

commit_message:
Update local.sh sample file to use OSC

Besides updating to OSC CLI, this patch also fixes an argument name typo
present before in 'nova keypair-add' (--pub_key should be --pub-key).

Specifying $OS_PROJECT_NAME in case user is associated to multiple
projects containing security groups with same name (e.g. 'default').

Change-Id: I776f6edfc4c6c798a39d3260827a18c695f05c87
(cherry picked from commit bac2e4ddc28393fbd3c6f45248737893b5d0fd97)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/47/397147/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: openstack keypair create --public-key $i `hostname` if [[ -z $(openstack flavor list | grep $MI_NAME) ]]; then openstack flavor create $MI_NAME --id 6 --ram 128 --disk 0 --vcpus 1 openstack security group rule create --project $OS_PROJECT_NAME default --protocol tcp --ingress --dst-port 22 openstack security group rule create --project $OS_PROJECT_NAME default --protocol icmp
deleted_lines: nova keypair-add --pub_key=$i `hostname` if [[ -z $(nova flavor-list | grep $MI_NAME) ]]; then nova flavor-create $MI_NAME 6 128 0 1 nova secgroup-add-rule default tcp 22 22 0.0.0.0/0 nova secgroup-add-rule default icmp -1 -1 0.0.0.0/0

commit_message:
Replaced e.message with str(e)

For logging the exception message: e.message has been
deprecated. The preferred way is to call str(e).

Change-Id: I9d18661efb77520f541762a776f319b401e6b46f

Remove dead code related to profile list

This patch removes dead code related to profile list in engine layer.

deleted_lines: @mock.patch.object(pb.Profile, 'load_all') def test_profile_list(self, mock_load): x_obj_1 = mock.Mock() x_obj_1.to_dict.return_value = {'k': 'v1'} x_obj_2 = mock.Mock() x_obj_2.to_dict.return_value = {'k': 'v2'} mock_load.return_value = [x_obj_1, x_obj_2] result = self.eng.profile_list(self.ctx) self.assertEqual([{'k': 'v1'}, {'k': 'v2'}], result) mock_load.assert_called_once_with(self.ctx, limit=None, marker=None, filters=None, sort=None, project_safe=True) @mock.patch.object(pb.Profile, 'load_all') def test_profile_list_with_params(self, mock_load): mock_load.return_value = [] result = self.eng.profile_list(self.ctx, limit=10, marker='KEY', filters={'foo': 'bar'}, sort='name:asc', project_safe=True) self.assertEqual([], result) mock_load.assert_called_once_with(self.ctx, limit=10, marker='KEY', filters={'foo': 'bar'}, sort='name:asc', project_safe=True) def test_profile_list_bad_param(self): ex = self.assertRaises(rpc.ExpectedException, self.eng.profile_list, self.ctx, limit='no') self.assertEqual(exc.InvalidParameter, ex.exc_info[0]) ex = self.assertRaises(rpc.ExpectedException, self.eng.profile_list, self.ctx, sort='crazykey') self.assertEqual(exc.InvalidParameter, ex.exc_info[0]) ex = self.assertRaises(rpc.ExpectedException, self.eng.profile_list, self.ctx, project_safe='no') self.assertEqual(exc.InvalidParameter, ex.exc_info[0]) @mock.patch.object(pb.Profile, 'load_all') def test_profile_list_with_project_safe(self, mock_load): mock_load.return_value = [] result = self.eng.profile_list(self.ctx) self.assertEqual([], result) mock_load.assert_called_once_with(self.ctx, filters=None, limit=None, sort=None, marker=None, project_safe=True) mock_load.reset_mock() ex = self.assertRaises(rpc.ExpectedException, self.eng.profile_list, self.ctx, project_safe=False) self.assertEqual(exc.Forbidden, ex.exc_info[0]) self.ctx.is_admin = True result = self.eng.profile_list(self.ctx) self.assertEqual([], result) mock_load.assert_called_once_with(self.ctx, filters=None, limit=None, sort=None, marker=None, project_safe=True) mock_load.reset_mock() result = self.eng.profile_list(self.ctx, project_safe=True) self.assertEqual([], result) mock_load.assert_called_once_with(self.ctx, filters=None, limit=None, sort=None, marker=None, project_safe=True) mock_load.reset_mock() result = self.eng.profile_list(self.ctx, project_safe=False) self.assertEqual([], result) mock_load.assert_called_once_with(self.ctx, filters=None, limit=None, sort=None, marker=None, project_safe=False)

Api support for event_list2

This patch adds API support for event_list2.

deprecated. The preferred way is to call str(e).

commit_message:
Replaced e.message with str(e)

For logging the exception message: e.message has been
deprecated. The preferred way is to call str(e).

Change-Id: Ic73a04835beb655d52686c67f04caa380ddff58d

commit_message:
Add Flatten Attributes Specification

Change-Id: I5a99b4917244e1c0ec7c9ed18faa7b660676510d
Implements: blueprint flatten-attributes
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/magnum refs/changes/94/393094/10 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ============================================== Flatten Cluster and ClusterTemplate Attributes ============================================== Launchpad blueprint: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/magnum/+spec/flatten-attributes Including all user-specified attributes in Clusters and ClusterTemplates will increase flexibility for users during ClusterTemplate definition and Cluster creation. Problem Description =================== Clusters rely on attributes from both the magnum Cluster and ClusterTemplate resources, but the line between attributes that belong in one or the other is not well-defined. Most attributes make sense where they are, but there will be times that users will want to capture different attributes in a ClusterTemplate or specify them during cluster creation. The current system has little flexibility, with only keypairs able to exist in either. Use Cases ========= 1. Users that want to have a different set of attributes captured in their ClusterTemplates than they are currently allowed to. 2. Users that want to have certain attributes specfied during Cluster creation instead of already defined in a ClusterTemplate. Proposed Change =============== 1. Add the attributes that users can specify in both ClusterTemplates and Clusters to both. Cluster: =================== ======= Attribute Shared? ------------------- ------- id uuid project_id user_id name stack_id status status_reason api_address trust_id trustee_username trustee_user_id trustee_password coe_version container_version ca_cert_ref magnum_cert_ref cluster_template_id node_addresses master_addresses create_timeout Yes discovery_url Yes node_count Yes master_count Yes =================== ======= ClusterTemplate: ===================== ======= Attribute Shared? --------------------- ------- id uuid project_id user_id name public apiserver_port Yes? keypair_id Yes labels Yes external_network_id Yes fixed_network Yes fixed_subnet Yes network_driver Yes volume_driver Yes dns_nameserver Yes coe Yes http_proxy Yes https_proxy Yes no_proxy Yes registry_enabled Yes tls_disabled Yes insecure_registry Yes master_lb_enabled Yes floating_ip_enabled Yes image_id Yes flavor_id Yes docker_volume_size Yes docker_storage_driver Yes cluster_distro Yes server_type Yes master_flavor_id Yes ===================== ======= 2. Update the ClusterTemplate API Make it so ClusterTemplates can be created with as few or as many attributes as desired. Attributes not specified will be set to the default, if there is one, or remain unset if there is not. A flag, --no-defaults, will be added to cluster-template-create, which keeps unspecified attributes unset instead of using default values. 3. Update the Cluster API Make it so that any attribute can be specified in cluster-create. Attributes already defined in the specified ClusterTemplate can still be specified, which will override the existing value. For simplicity in implementation, a ClusterTemplate will still need to be specified, even though technically all of a ClusterTemplate's attributes can be overridden when creating a cluster. Design Principles ================= .. TODO Alternatives ============ .. TODO Data Model Impact ================= A new database table, ClusterAttributes, will be added. The shared fields (see Proposed Change) will be moved to this table. A foreign key to ClusterAttributes will be added to the Cluster and ClusterTemplate tables. The relationship between Cluster and ClusterAttributes is one-to-one. The same is true between ClusterTemplate and ClusterAttributes. That is, Clusters and ClusterTemplates have their own separate copy of cluster attributes. **Alternate implementation option** The shared fields can be added to the existing Cluster and ClusterTemplate tables. This acheives the same effect, but brings with it the burden of maintaining two sets of the same fields in different tables. .. TODO Expand this section if needed REST API Impact =============== **cluster-create** - Create a Cluster:: magnum cluster-create [--name <name>] \ --cluster-template <ClusterTemplate name or UUID> \ [--<parameter> <value>] Cluster Name Positional, Optional Default: <Auto-generated name> This specifies the name that will be used for this cluster. If not provided a name will be auto-generated for the cluster. --cluster-template <ClusterTemplate name or UUID> Required Copies attributes from the specified ClusterTemplate. --<parameter> <value> If a parameter was not set in the ClusterTemplate that was specified the parameter *must* be included. Parameters can also be specified to override defaults or values that would otherwise be taken from the ClusterTemplate. **cluster-template-create** - Creates a ClusterTemplate:: magnum cluster-template-create [--name <name>] [--no-defaults] [--public] \ [--<parameter> <value> ...] (Note that all parameters are optional in ClusterTemplates) ClusterTemplate Name Positional, Optional Default: <Auto-generated name> Specifies the ClusterTemplate name. If not provided, a name will be auto-generated. --no-defaults Optional Specifies that the created cluster template will not use any default values. The only values set will be those that the user explicitly specified. This makes it easier to create a completely empty/customized template. --public Optional Default: False Makes the ClusterTemplate visible/available to all tenants. --<parameter> <value> Optional Parameters whose values will be copied to the Cluster during cluster-create. All parameters are optional when creating ClusterTemplates. Security Impact =============== .. TODO Notifications Impact ==================== .. TODO Other End-user Impact ===================== .. TODO Performance Impact ================== .. TODO Other Deployer Impact ===================== .. TODO Developer Impact ================ .. TODO Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- .. TODO Work Items ---------- .. TODO Dependencies ============ .. TODO Testing ======= .. TODO Documentation Impact ==================== .. TODO References ========== .. TODO

This patch allows k8s coreos cluster to be created
without Floating IP resources.

commit_message:
Spec for protecting swarm infra containers

blueprint docker-authz-plugin

Change-Id: Ic60fd2086e66d765b2d366989429747c4c0a12b9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/magnum refs/changes/00/385700/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ================================= Protect swarm Infrastructure Containers ================================= Launchpad blueprint: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/magnum/+spec/docker-authz-plugin At present, user can accidentally delete swarm infrastructure containers from the swarm cluster. Problem Description ------------------- Magnum creates infrastructure containers (swarm-manager, swarm-agent) as part of swarm cluster creation. These infrastructure containers are not well protected by Magnum and as a result user can accidentally delete one or more of these infra containers from the cluster. Deleting infrastructure containers may leave the cluster in non-operational state. Use Cases --------- Proposed Changes ---------------- Magnum can implement a docker authorization plugin that can intercept the request being sent to the docker daemon and reject the request by returning an error message if user tries to delete an infra container from the cluster. Docker authorization plugin details can be found at [1] Alternatives ------------ Without infrastructure container protection feature, user may need to delete existing non-operational cluster and create a new cluster. Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- None. Security impact --------------- If the docker authorization plugin is downloaded and installed during the cluster creation time, we need to validate the binary executable that is being installed on the cluster. Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None Performance impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- There are few options to install docker authorization plug in a new swarm cluster. 1. Pre-install docker authorization plugin on the image 2. Download docker authorization plugin executable during the cluster creation time and install it. 3. Download the authorization plugin source code during cluster creation on to the cluster nodes and then build and install it. Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation -------------- Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee vijendar-komalla(Vijendar Komalla) Work Items ---------- Dependencies ------------ None Testing ------- All the existing test cases are run to ensure docker authorization plugin does not break them. Additionally couple of functional tests will be added to make sure that infrastructure containers can not be deleted. Documentation Impact -------------------- None References ---------- [1] - Docker authorization plugins: https://docs.docker.com/engine/extend/plugins_authorization/ [2] - Proposed change under review: https://review.openstack.org/383061

commit_message:
Fixing problems with tox

Remove options -w and -e. Both those options throws an error:
 nosetests: error: no such option: -w
Run nosetest in a specified dir and add verbose option.

Change-Id: I20c2b95431f755222ae523f5cc0ef217ff157c6c

Since the related change [1] the auditor checks deleted objects in
case their tombstone is ready to be reclaimed. However, the auditor
mistakes an expired object for a deleted object because
DiskFileExpired is a subclass of DiskFileDeleted. This causes a
KeyError to be raised and logged because the expired object has no
tombstone info in the ondisk_info data structure.

This patch makes the auditor catch and ignore DiskFileExpired
exceptions before handling DiskFileDeleted exceptions.

[1] Related-Change: I3e99dc702d55a7424c6482969e03cb4afac854a4

Change-Id: I9872b6997d09dcfd8a868c4b91b9379407283b8e
Closes-Bug: #1638016
(cherry picked from commit a4d77d918d99dfa8a1e7f1b0561769a17ba64932)

commit_message:
Fix KeyError when auditor finds an expired object

Since the related change [1] the auditor checks deleted objects in
case their tombstone is ready to be reclaimed. However, the auditor
mistakes an expired object for a deleted object because
DiskFileExpired is a subclass of DiskFileDeleted. This causes a
KeyError to be raised and logged because the expired object has no
tombstone info in the ondisk_info data structure.

This patch makes the auditor catch and ignore DiskFileExpired
exceptions before handling DiskFileDeleted exceptions.

[1] Related-Change: I3e99dc702d55a7424c6482969e03cb4afac854a4

Change-Id: I9872b6997d09dcfd8a868c4b91b9379407283b8e
Closes-Bug: #1638016
(cherry picked from commit a4d77d918d99dfa8a1e7f1b0561769a17ba64932)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/44/393444/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: DiskFileDeleted, DiskFileExpired except DiskFileExpired: pass # ignore expired objects

commit_message:
(WIP)Docker auth plugin to prevent deletion of infra containers

Magnum creates couple of infrastructure containers(swarm-manager,
swarm-agent) as part of swarm cluster creation. This patch is to
prevent accidental deletion of these infra containers.
This change assumes that docker authorization plugin is built and
uploaded to a publicly accessible URL.

Change-Id: I7aaab91944c97cebbd22eb4a8bc564dcd0c97317
Implements: blueprint docker-authz-plugin

added_lines: import pdb pdb.set_trace()class IndexProjectToImage(command.Lister): """Accept or deny the image sharing for a project""" def get_parser(self, prog_name): parser = super(IndexProjectToImage, self).get_parser(prog_name) parser.add_argument( "image", metavar="<image>", help=_("Image is share (name or ID)"), ) common.add_project_domain_option_to_parser(parser) return parser def take_action(self, parsed_args): image_client = self.app.client_manager.image identity_client = self.app.client_manager.identity image_id = utils.find_resource( image_client.images, parsed_args.image).id data = image_client.image_members.list(image_id) columns = ['Image ID', 'Member ID', 'Status'] return (columns, (utils.get_dict_properties( s, columns, formatters={}, ) for s in data)) class UpdateProjectToImage(command.ShowOne): """Accept or deny the image sharing for a project""" def get_parser(self, prog_name): parser = super(UpdateProjectToImage, self).get_parser(prog_name) parser.add_argument( "image", metavar="<image>", help=_("Image to share (name or ID)"), ) parser.add_argument( "project", metavar="<project>", help=_("Project to associate with image (name or ID)"), ) parser.add_argument( "status", metavar="<status>", choices=["accepted", "rejected", "pending"], help=_("Updated status of the sharing. Valid Values: accepted, " "rejected, pending."), ) common.add_project_domain_option_to_parser(parser) return parser def take_action(self, parsed_args): image_client = self.app.client_manager.image identity_client = self.app.client_manager.identity project_id = common.find_project(identity_client, parsed_args.project, parsed_args.project_domain).id image_id = utils.find_resource( image_client.images, parsed_args.image).id image_member = image_client.image_members.update( image_id, project_id, parsed_args.status ) return zip(*sorted(six.iteritems(image_member)))

notifications are emitted on, since previously that required looking at

commit_message:
Add notification documentation to administrator's guide

This moves the description of available notifications in ironic to the
administrator's guide and briefly describes how to configure
notifications. It also documents the message bus topic ironic
notifications are emitted on, since previously that required looking at
code to find out.

Related-Bug: #1526408
Change-Id: I4d5dfe92d2c2646a7cc803fa6ea7ade723aba310
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/44/389344/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. _notifications: ============= Notifications ============= Ironic, when configured to do so, will emit notifications over a message bus that indicate different events that occur within the service. These can be consumed by any external service. Examples may include a billing or usage system, a monitoring data store, or other OpenStack services. This page describes how to enable notifications and the different kinds of notifications that ironic may emit. The external consumer will see notifications emitted by ironic as JSON objects structured in the following manner:: { "priority": <string, defined by the sender>, "event_type": <string, defined by the sender>, "timestamp": <string, the isotime of when the notification emitted>, "publisher_id": <string, defined by the sender>, "message_id": <uuid, generated by oslo>, "payload": <json serialized dict, defined by the sender> } .. _configuration: Configuration ============= To enable notifications with ironic, there are two configuration options that must be adjusted. The first option is the ``notification_level`` option in the ``[DEFAULT]`` section of the configuration. This can be set to "debug", "info", "warning", "error", or "critical", and determines the minimum priority level for which notifications are emitted. For example, if the option is set to "warning", all notifications with priority level "warning", "error", or "critical" are emitted, but not notifications with priority level "debug" or "info". If this option is unset, no notifications will be emitted. The priority level of each available notification is documented below. The second option is the ``transport_url`` option in the ``[oslo_messaging_notifications]`` section of the configuration. This determines the message bus used when sending notifications. If this is unset, the default transport used for RPC is used. All notifications are emitted on the "ironic_versioned_notifications" topic in the message bus. .. _available_notifications: Available notifications ======================= .. TODO(mariojv) Add some form of tabular formatting below The notifications that ironic emits are described here. They are listed (alphabetically) by service first, then by event_type. All examples below show payloads before serialization to JSON. ------------------------------ ironic-conductor notifications ------------------------------ baremetal.node.power_set ------------------------ * ``baremetal.node.power_set.start`` is emitted by the ironic-conductor service when it begins a power state change. It has notification level INFO. * ``baremetal.node.power_set.end`` is emitted when ironic-conductor successfully completes a power state change task. It has notification level INFO. * ``baremetal.node.power_set.error`` is emitted by ironic-conductor when it fails to set a node's power state. It has notification level ERROR. This can occur when ironic fails to retrieve the old power state prior to setting the new one on the node, or when it fails to set the power state if a change is requested. Here is an example payload for a notification with this event type. The "to_power" payload field indicates the power state to which the ironic-conductor is attempting to change the node:: { "priority": "info", "payload":{ "ironic_object.namespace":"ironic", "ironic_object.name":"NodeSetPowerStatePayload", "ironic_object.version":"1.0", "ironic_object.data":{ "clean_step": None, "console_enabled": False, "created_at": "2016-01-26T20:41:03+00:00", "driver": "fake", "extra": {}, "inspection_finished_at": None, "inspection_started_at": None, "instance_uuid": "d6ea00c1-1f94-4e95-90b3-3462d7031678", "last_error": None, "maintenance": False, "maintenance_reason": None, "network_interface": "flat", "name": None, "power_state": "power off", "properties": { "memory_mb": 4096, "cpu_arch": "x86_64", "local_gb": 10, "cpus": 8}, "provision_state": "available", "provision_updated_at": "2016-01-27T20:41:03+00:00", "resource_class": None, "target_power_state": None, "target_provision_state": None, "updated_at": "2016-01-27T20:41:03+00:00", "uuid": "1be26c0b-03f2-4d2e-ae87-c02d7f33c123", "to_power": "power on" } }, "event_type":"baremetal.node.power_set.start", "publisher_id":"ironic-conductor.hostname01" } baremetal.node.power_state_corrected ------------------------------------ * ``baremetal.node.power_state_corrected.success`` is emitted by ironic-conductor when the power state on the baremetal hardware is different from the previous known power state of the node and the database is corrected to reflect this new power state. It has notification level INFO. Here is an example payload for a notification with this event_type. The "from_power" payload field indicates the previous power state on the node, prior to the correction:: { "priority": "info", "payload":{ "ironic_object.namespace":"ironic", "ironic_object.name":"NodeCorrectedPowerStatePayload", "ironic_object.version":"1.0", "ironic_object.data":{ "clean_step": None, "console_enabled": False, "created_at": "2016-01-26T20:41:03+00:00", "driver": "fake", "extra": {}, "inspection_finished_at": None, "inspection_started_at": None, "instance_uuid": "d6ea00c1-1f94-4e95-90b3-3462d7031678", "last_error": None, "maintenance": False, "maintenance_reason": None, "network_interface": "flat", "name": None, "power_state": "power off", "properties": { "memory_mb": 4096, "cpu_arch": "x86_64", "local_gb": 10, "cpus": 8}, "provision_state": "available", "provision_updated_at": "2016-01-27T20:41:03+00:00", "resource_class": None, "target_power_state": None, "target_provision_state": None, "updated_at": "2016-01-27T20:41:03+00:00", "uuid": "1be26c0b-03f2-4d2e-ae87-c02d7f33c123", "from_power": "power on" } }, "event_type":"baremetal.node.power_state_corrected.success", "publisher_id":"ironic-conductor.cond-hostname02" }

commit_message:
Fix oslo.i18n problems in magnum

Help msg in magnum project should support oslo.i18n. But tests
directory faces developer, So it needn't support oslo.i18n.

Partial-Bug: #1627616

Change-Id: Ib95850e6da28dc4ba501e0318e85becdb5c64599

subject: SLO: Concurrently HEAD segments
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-30 20:50:09.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/2741abf803801ac90780ed76da6730560efa611c', 'message': "SLO: Concurrently HEAD segments

Before creating a static large object, we must verify that all of the
referenced segments exist. Previously, this was done sequentially; due
to latency between proxy and object nodes, clients must be careful to
either keep their segment count low or use very long (minute+) timeouts.
We mitigate this somewhat by enforcing a hard limit on segment count,
but even then, HEADing a thousand segments (the default limit) with an
average latency of (say) 100ms will require more than a minute and a
half.

Further, the nested-SLO approach requires multiple requests from the
client -- as a result, Swift3 is in the position of enforcing a lower
limit than S3's 10,000 (which will break some clients) or requiring that
clients have timeouts on the order of 15-20 minutes (!).

Now, we'll perform the segment HEADs in parallel, with a concurrency
factor set by the operator. This is very similar to (and builds upon)
the parallel-bulk-delete work. By default, two HEAD requests will be
allowed at a time.

As a side-effect, we'll also only ever HEAD a path once per manifest.
Previously, if a manifest alternated between two paths repeatedly (for
instance, because the user wanted to splice together various ranges from
two sub-SLOs), then each entry in the manifest would trigger a fresh
HEAD request.

Upgrade Consideration
=====================
If operators would like to preserve the prior (single-threaded) SLO
creation behavior, they must add the following line to their
[filter:slo] proxy config section:

   concurrency = 1

This may be done prior to upgrading Swift.

UpgradeImpact
Closes-Bug: ###
Related-Change: I128374d74a4cef7a479b221fd15eec785cc4694a
Change-Id: I567949567ecdbd94fa06d1dd5d3cdab0d97207b6

commit_message:
SLO: Concurrently HEAD segments

Before creating a static large object, we must verify that all of the
referenced segments exist. Previously, this was done sequentially; due
to latency between proxy and object nodes, clients must be careful to
either keep their segment count low or use very long (minute+) timeouts.
We mitigate this somewhat by enforcing a hard limit on segment count,
but even then, HEADing a thousand segments (the default limit) with an
average latency of (say) 100ms will require more than a minute and a
half.

Further, the nested-SLO approach requires multiple requests from the
client -- as a result, Swift3 is in the position of enforcing a lower
limit than S3's 10,000 (which will break some clients) or requiring that
clients have timeouts on the order of 15-20 minutes (!).

Now, we'll perform the segment HEADs in parallel, with a concurrency
factor set by the operator. This is very similar to (and builds upon)
the parallel-bulk-delete work. By default, two HEAD requests will be
allowed at a time.

As a side-effect, we'll also only ever HEAD a path once per manifest.
Previously, if a manifest alternated between two paths repeatedly (for
instance, because the user wanted to splice together various ranges from
two sub-SLOs), then each entry in the manifest would trigger a fresh
HEAD request.

Upgrade Consideration
=====================
If operators would like to preserve the prior (single-threaded) SLO
creation behavior, they must add the following line to their
[filter:slo] proxy config section:

   concurrency = 1

This may be done prior to upgrading Swift.

UpgradeImpact
Closes-Bug: #1637133
Related-Change: I128374d74a4cef7a479b221fd15eec785cc4694a
Change-Id: I567949567ecdbd94fa06d1dd5d3cdab0d97207b6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/82/391682/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # When creating an SLO, multiple segment validations may be executed in # parallel. Further, multiple deletes may be executed in parallel when deleting # with?multipart-manifest=delete. Use this setting to limit how many # subrequests may be executed concurrently. Avoid setting it too high, as it # gives clients a force multiplier which may be used in DoS attacks. The # suggested range is between 2 and 10. # concurrency = 2 # # This may be used to separately tune validation and delete concurrency values. # Default is to use the concurrency value from above; all of the same caveats # apply regarding recommended ranges.
deleted_lines: # When deleting with ?multipart-manifest=delete, multiple deletes may be # executed in parallel. Avoid setting this too high, as it gives clients a # force multiplier which may be used in DoS attacks. The suggested range is # between 2 and 10.

commit_message:
Properly read MySQL/MariaDB configuration file

Existing code didn't work well, as it could read options
from sections which were after the [client] section
(client_section variable was never set back to False).

Also used six to make this work for Python2 and Python3

Change-Id: Icd7339e561d08492ccede97defc53f906c072abf
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/monasca-agent refs/changes/54/398354/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from six.moves import configparser parser = configparser.RawConfigParser(defaults={ 'user': None, 'password': None, 'host': HOST, 'port': PORT, 'socket': None, 'ssl_ca': None, 'ssl_key': None, 'ssl_cert': None }, allow_no_value=True) parser.read(config_file) self.user = parser.get('client', 'user') self.password = parser.get('client', 'password') self.host = parser.get('client', 'host') self.port = parser.get('client', 'port') self.socket = parser.get('client', 'socket') self.ssl_ca = parser.get('client', 'ssl_ca') self.ssl_key = parser.get('client', 'ssl_key') self.ssl_cert = parser.get('client', 'ssl_cert')
deleted_lines: client_section = False self.user = None self.password = None self.host = HOST self.port = PORT self.socket = None self.ssl_ca = None self.ssl_key = None self.ssl_cert = None with open(mysql_conf, "r") as confFile: for row in confFile: if client_section: if "user=" in row: self.user = row.split("=")[1].strip() if "password=" in row: self.password = row.split("=")[1].strip() if "port=" in row: self.port = int(row.split("=")[1].strip()) if "host=" in row: self.host = row.split("=")[1].strip() if "socket=" in row: self.socket = row.split("=")[1].strip() if "ssl_ca=" in row: self.ssl_ca = row.split("=")[1].strip() if "ssl_key=" in row: self.ssl_key = row.split("=")[1].strip() if "ssl_cert=" in row: self.ssl_cert = row.split("=")[1].strip() if "[client]" in row: client_section = True

commit_message:
Stop setting route pointing back to tenant router

This removes the logic to add a route pointing to the IPv4
tenant private network range since the router is performing
SNAT. If reaching the IPs via the route worked at all, it was
by accident since this behavior is certainly not guaranteed
by Neutron.

Change-Id: If45e3fc15c050cfbac11b57c1eaf137dd7ed816f

commit_message:
Set cn_map permissions/owner

This patch sets the owner, group owner, and permissions for
/etc/pam_pkcs11/cn_map if the file exists. Docs will follow.

Implements: security-rhel7-stig
Change-Id: If8b31cdc192bcbfe519dc9ec1e6b458309269f42
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-security refs/changes/93/397893/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - name: Check if cn_map file is present stat: path: /etc/pam_pkcs11/cn_map check_mode: no register: cn_map_check tags: - medium - file_perms - RHEL-07-040060 - RHEL-07-040070 - RHEL-07-040080 - name: Set file permissions on cn_map file file: path: /etc/pam_pkcs11/cn_map mode: "u-x,g-wx,o-wx" owner: root group: root when: - cn_map_check.stat.exists tags: - medium - file_perms - RHEL-07-040060 - RHEL-07-040070 - RHEL-07-040080

As per OpenStack licensing guide lines [1]:

[H104] Files with no code shouldn't contain any license header nor
comments, and must be left completely empty.
[H102 H103] Newly contributed Source Code should be licensed under
the Apache 2.0 license.

Change-Id: I99eeccb0d13da441ff8ffe8869889e6f2559c49f

commit_message:
Files with no code must be left completely empty

As per OpenStack licensing guide lines [1]:

[H104] Files with no code shouldn't contain any license header nor
comments, and must be left completely empty.
[H102 H103] Newly contributed Source Code should be licensed under
the Apache 2.0 license.

[1]http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#openstack-licensing

Change-Id: I99eeccb0d13da441ff8ffe8869889e6f2559c49f

Adds liberty-era dashboard screenshots for admin-guide

any information you would not want to share. TryStack will
update to Mitaka this quarter most likely.

commit_message:
Stop adding ServiceAvailable group option

Service available group already exists.Therefore we don't need to
register this group here again.

Change-Id: I5b7180192b8f41fda2983c03778fc2463cd24794
Closes-Bug: #1621036

subject: Fix using filter() to meet python2,3
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-26 08:09:04.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/magnum/commit/853dbbf7668ac1f6a6f4ca08e87f64dfd3eee08f', 'message': 'Fix using filter() to meet python2,3

As mentioned in link[1], if we need filter() on python3,
Raplace filter(lambda obj: test(obj), data) with:
[obj for obj in data if test(obj)].

[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
TrivialFix.

Change-Id: If076b3572c3196fc85fe4652a02d9496caff443b
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-09-26 10:10:35.000000000', 'files': ['magnum/common/safe_utils.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/magnum/commit/a65fc6ae35caa60babf6c70c191ebd66cd8a1df8', 'message': 'Fix using filter() to meet python2,3

As mentioned in link[1], if we need filter() on python3,
Raplace filter(lambda obj: test(obj), data) with:
[obj for obj in data if test(obj)].

TrivialFix.

Change-Id: If076b3572c3196fc85fe4652a02d9496caff443b
'}]
commit_message:
Fix using filter() to meet python2,3

As mentioned in link[1], if we need filter() on python3,
Raplace filter(lambda obj: test(obj), data) with:
[obj for obj in data if test(obj)].

[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
TrivialFix.

Change-Id: If076b3572c3196fc85fe4652a02d9496caff443b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/magnum refs/changes/79/376279/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: remaining_argnames = [x for x not in keyed_args, argnames]
deleted_lines: remaining_argnames = filter(lambda x: x not in keyed_args, argnames)

commit_message:
Make n-net refuse to start unless using CellsV1

At the Barcenlona summit, we discussed disabling n-net everywhere as a
precursor to removal. The only exception for using n-net is as required
for CellsV1 users, which require it as the only out-of-the-box supported
networking option.

We will remove this check and n-net entirely when those users have a
migration path to neutron and cellsv2.

Depends-On: I47f72eac6a7657bf44319fa5d2df18ce62827f6f

Change-Id: I7309afa5230bcaeeeddb554d95c327d3a614ae6e
