subject: [WIP] Cluster restart lifecycle operation for k8s
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-12 17:04:54.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/magnum/commit/6a357d7017c3f464cc17534767c80e3fa213d11e', 'message': '[WIP] Cluster restart lifecycle operation for k8s

WIP: Bake container agent image into Atomic image
WIP: Unit tests
WIP: Functional tests
WIP: Switch to bay-restart-operation blueprint

This patch adds support for cluster lifecycle operations, starting with
the restart operation. The restart action restarts the COE services on
the master and worker nodes. The endpoint does not accept a request
body and responds with a 204 with no response body. The endpoint is:

PATCH /clusters/{id}/actions/restart

Cluster lifecycle operations that deal with software on a node (such as
restart) use a containerized version of the software config agent
(os-collect-config and friends) that can poll Heat to receive
software updates.

Change-Id: I4f5a9f01726fa28dde6a1be7bdce5f79a31e8045
Partially-implements: blueprint bay-rebuild-operation

commit_message:
[WIP] Cluster restart lifecycle operation for k8s

WIP: Bake container agent image into Atomic image
  - Image to test with: https://test-fedora-23-ironic-image.web.cern.ch/test-fedora-23-ironic-image/fedora-atomic-23-drago.qcow2

This patch adds support for cluster lifecycle operations, starting with
the restart operation. The restart action restarts the COE services on
the master and worker nodes. The endpoint does not accept a request
body and responds with a 204 with no response body. The endpoint is:

PATCH /clusters/{id}/actions/restart

Cluster lifecycle operations that deal with software on a node (such as
restart) use a containerized version of the software config agent
(os-collect-config and friends) that can poll Heat to receive
software updates.

Change-Id: I4f5a9f01726fa28dde6a1be7bdce5f79a31e8045
Depends-On: I2ff7fdcd75d9700c0584a12c3f01a509e4b5725e
Depends-On: Ia49a549e11e2e6a1e9399a1370f990780c17bf0d
Depends-on: I9f44803cf04b572074bdb4b97ee58827c5611514
Partially-Implements: blueprint cluster-restart-operation

added_lines: #!/bin/bash set -eux # heat-docker-agent service cat <<EOF > /etc/systemd/system/heat-container-agent.service [Unit] Description=Heat Container Agent After=docker.service Requires=docker.service [Service] User=root Restart=on-failure ExecStartPre=-/usr/bin/docker kill heat-container-agent ExecStartPre=-/usr/bin/docker rm heat-container-agent ExecStartPre=/usr/bin/docker pull docker.io/dragorosson/heat-container-agent3 ExecStart=/usr/bin/docker run --name heat-container-agent --privileged --net=host -v /run/systemd:/run/systemd -v /var/lib/heat-cfntools:/var/lib/heat-cfntools -v /var/lib/cloud:/var/lib/cloud docker.io/dragorosson/heat-container-agent3 ExecStop=/usr/bin/docker stop heat-container-agent [Install] WantedBy=multi-user.target EOF # enable and start docker /usr/bin/systemctl enable docker.service /usr/bin/systemctl start --no-block docker.service # enable and start heat-container-agent chmod 0640 /etc/systemd/system/heat-container-agent.service /usr/bin/systemctl enable heat-container-agent.service /usr/bin/systemctl start --no-block heat-container-agent.service

commit_message:
Hacking check for contextlib.nested for py34 support

Removed use of contextlib.nested call from codebase as
contextlib.nested is not compatible with Python 3.

Added hacking check to catch if any new instances are added
to the codebase.

Change-Id: I6026e4b13f9a45e44aafdff54627b63604ddf86b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/magnum refs/changes/73/361573/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: contextlib_nested = re.compile(r"^with (contextlib\.)?nested\(") policy_enforce_re = re.compile(r".*_ENFORCER\.enforce\(")def check_policy_enforce(logical_line, filename): """Look for uses of nova.policy._ENFORCER.enforce() Now that policy defaults are registered in code the _ENFORCER.authorize method should be used. That ensures that only registered policies are used. Uses of _ENFORCER.enforce could allow unregistered policies to be used, so this check looks for uses of that method. N351 """ msg = ('N351: nova.policy._ENFORCER.enforce() should not be used. ' 'Use the authorize() method instead.') if policy_enforce_re.match(logical_line): yield(0, msg) def check_no_contextlib_nested(logical_line, filename): msg = ("N341: contextlib.nested is deprecated. With Python 2.7 and later " "the with-statement supports multiple nested objects. See https://" "docs.python.org/2/library/contextlib.html#contextlib.nested for " "more information. nova.test.nested() is an alternative as well.") if contextlib_nested.match(logical_line): yield(0, msg) register(check_no_contextlib_nested) register(check_policy_enforce)

commit_message:
Templates and scripts for Kuryr

Libnetwork support in Swarm Fedora Atomic driver

Update the templates and scripts for Swarm Fedora Atomic
to support the option --network-driver=kuryr.  The script for
Kuryr creates the necessary Neutron config files and systemd
services to start up two containers:  the Openvswitch
container and the Kuryr container.  The OpenVswitch
container runs the Openvswitch service and Neutron L2
agent for Openvswitch.  The Kuryr container runs the
Kuryr libnetwork service to respond to request from
Docker.

This integration works with the Mitaka version of Kuryr
libnetwork.  The new refactored Kuryr driver is not yet
ready, so some re-work may be necessary whene it will be
ready.  No functional difference is expected between the
Mitaka and Newton version of the libnetwork driver.

This patch covers the templates and the scripts.
Follow-on patches will add the config parameters and
enable the driver.

Partially implements: blueprint kuryr-swarm-integration
Change-Id: I81f60f522753fda204d5f8006868872a0d9e8adf

commit_message:
Config parameters for Kuryr

Add parameters in magnum.conf for Kuryr

Add the section kuryr_driver for configuring Kuryr
as the network driver for Swarm.
The current parameters are for the Mitaka version of Kuryr
and they are expected to be changed soon in the refactored
version in Newton.

This patch is for testing and not intended for production
use.

Partially implements: blueprint kuryr-swarm-integration
Change-Id: I79a7a262d1ff15e5b57e686bc1835088066ffb61

commit_message:
test: make enforce_type=True in CONF.set_override

Each config option has limitation for type and value.
In production code, oslo.conf can ensure user's input
is valid, but in unit test, test methods can pass if
we use method CONF.set_override without parameter
enforce_type=True even we pass wrong type or wrong
value to config option. This commit makes sure calling
method CONF.set_override with enforce_type=True

Change-Id: Id04be158467ad613aca73139fa42c38772fdc883
Closes-Bug: #1517839
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/magnum refs/changes/67/365967/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: CONF.set_override('policy_file', self.policy_file_name, 'oslo_policy', enforce_type=True)

commit_message:
[WIP][PoC] Add generator for API reference in OpenAPI format

**DO NOT MERGE**

This patch adds OpenAPI formatted reference generator.

Run "tox -e=openapi" command, OpenAPI JSON file will be
created in openapi directory.

**note**
pecan-swagger is customized for this patch at following
personal repo[1]. Working with original author Michael McCune,
but before merging our changes into original repo, pecan-swagger
will be installed from personal repo[1] using tox.ini.
[1] https://github.com/shu-mutou/pecan-swagger

Change-Id: I88210ac1b6b19592fbbb5ea3cc3f64afd4246cca
Implements: blueprint magnum-api-swagger-support
Co-Authored-By: OTSUKA, Yuanying <yuanying@fraction.jp>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/magnum refs/changes/35/303235/12 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from magnum.common.pecan_swagger import decorators as swagger@swagger.path('services', 'Services', 'V1')

commit_message:
Allow magnum services to be deleted by admin

Only magnum service list is supported in magnum. For environment
where a HA cluster is setup, in that case node deletion and
replacement may lead to services is in down state permanently.
After node deletion or replacement this information is there,
which is actually showing wrong status. Admin must have this
functionality to delete the service and keep the enviornment
in clean state.

There are options in nova and neutron etc. but cinder does not
have this option. In our product, we delete it from database, which
is definitely not a good idea to manipulate database. Let the
service manipulate it and let it take care of dependencies.

Change-Id: I9a6d1e36406d2792fd390aa8000a4aae0bdca31b
Closes-Bug: #1607230

commit_message:
Added Support for Listing all the information of magnum service.

REST API has been added to show a magnum service based on the
service ID.

Change-Id: I41fc5b13bcb9aca27e6f9aec5a8b8b8c79635b1e
Closes-bug: #1607234

commit_message:
Neutron loadbalancer uses incorrect security group

As per bug, when loadbalancer is created then port is also created
and default security group is attached. And i could not find any
method of attaching security group to port using heat templates.

A neutron client class has been made, which creates security group
and security rules. Then security group is attached to port for
fedora kubernetes driver.

Change-Id: Ic0c2f6d3bb52c4cf87cbb4a585d9bce50d6c9b13
Closes-Bug: #1605416

added_lines: from magnum.conductor.handlers.common.neutron import NeutronClient if bay['baymodel'].coe == 'kubernetes': lb_port = osc.heat().stacks.output_show(bay.stack_id, 'lb_port_id') port_id = lb_port['outout']['output_value'] NeutronClient(osc).allow_ports([6443, 2379], port_id)

commit_message:
Allow disable/enable a magnum service.

Admin is allowed to disable or enable a magnum service, in case
controllers has to be taken off for maintanence purpose.

Only disabled and disabled_reason is allowed to change.

Change-Id: I4e86c84ccf86a0a8a4e26c53ba23e63df03954f8
Closes-bug: #1607228

commit_message:
Add the supporting-container-images-in-mesos-containerizer doc

Some slave flags can be use to implement feature about the
support container images. So add the support container image doc

Change-Id: I93c97ce1b2b6ddcccaa799ae856769998c54f1ed
Partially-Implements:blueprint mesos-slave-flags
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/magnum refs/changes/06/315406/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ================================================== Supporting Container Images in Mesos Containerizer ================================================== Supporting Container Images in Mesos Containerizer is introduced in the link (https://github.com/apache/mesos/blob/master/docs/container-image.md) How supporting container images in mesos containerizer is deployed ================================================================== **NOTE** Supporting container image in mesos containerizer should be deployed in mesos bay and need the mesos version >=0.28.0 1. Build the newest image and store the image in the glance according to the link:: https://github.com/openstack/magnum/blob/master/doc/source/dev/mesos.rst 2. Create the baymodel. The new attribute mesos_slave_isolation, mesos_slave_image_providers and mesos_slave_executor_file_url are added the labels for a baymodel. The attribute mesos_slave_isolation need to be turned on in order to provide proper isolation according to the runtime configurations specified in the container image. The operator needs to add the following isolators to the mesos_slave_isolation flag:: ``filesystem/linux``: This is needed because supporting container images involves changing filesystem root, and only filesystem/linux support that currently. Note that this isolator requires root permission. ``docker/runtime``: This is used to provide support for runtime configurations specified in Docker images (e.g., Entrypoint/Cmd, environment variables, etc.). See more details about this isolator in Mesos containerizer doc(https://github.com/apache/mesos/blob/master/docs/ mesos-containerizer.md). Note that if this isolator is not specified and "mesos_slave_ image_providers" contains docker, the agent will refuse to start. The attribute mesos_slave_image_providers is Comma-separated list of supported image providers, e.g., appc,docker, If mesos_slave_image_providers contains docker, this isolator must be used. Otherwise, slave will refuse to start. The attribute mesos_slave_executor_file_url is a url of mesos environment variables json file. The file is a JSON object representing the environment variables that should be passed to the executor, and thus subsequently task(s). By default the executor will inherit the slave's environment variables. Example:: { "PATH": "/bin:/usr/bin", "LD_LIBRARY_PATH": "/usr/local/lib" } $echo {} > /opt/stack/magnum/environment_variables.json Here we don't set the variables to inherit the slave's environment variables $magnum baymodel-create --name mesosbaymodel \ --image-id ubuntu-mesos \ --keypair testkey \ --external-network-id public \ --dns-nameserver 8.8.8.8 \ --master-flavor-id m1.magnum \ --docker-volume-size 4 \ --tls-disabled \ --flavor-id m1.magnum \ --coe mesos \ --labels mesos_slave_isolation=docker/runtime,filesystem/linux \ --labels mesos_slave_executor_file_url=/opt/stack/magnum/environment_variables.json \ --labels mesos_slave_work_dir=/tmp/mesos/slave \ --labels mesos_slave_image_providers=docker 3. Create the bay:: magnum bay-create --name mesosbay --baymodel mesosbaymodel --node-count 1 4.Log into master node of your bay and perform the following step:: sudo mesos execute --master=<MASTER_IP>::5050 --name=test --docker_image=library/redis --shell=false It will show the following information:: I0512 07:16:06.716464 2258 sched.cpp:222] Version: 0.28.1 I0512 07:16:06.848107 2265 sched.cpp:326] New master detected at master@10.0.0.4:5050 I0512 07:16:06.892675 2265 sched.cpp:336] No credentials provided. Attempting to register without authentication I0512 07:16:07.017516 2261 sched.cpp:703] Framework registered with cce4bfde-1881-4d1f-8b5b-46ac93b04492-0001 Framework registered with cce4bfde-1881-4d1f-8b5b-46ac93b04492-0001 task test submitted to slave cce4bfde-1881-4d1f-8b5b-46ac93b04492-S0 Received status update TASK_RUNNING for task test 5.Log into each agent node of your baby and perform the following step to verify if your container is running by launching a redis client:: sudo docker run -ti --net=host redis redis-cli 127.0.0.1:6379> ping PONG 127.0.0.1:6379> You will find the image pulled in the '/tmp/mesos/slave'

commit_message:
Add hacking rule for HTTPNotImplemented

This patch adds check for HTTPNotImplemented response
must be implemented with common raise_feature_not_supported().

Change-Id: Ic9c32d4aa3005a82108fdd12e538959bf3dba599
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/magnum refs/changes/84/349184/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import pep8http_not_implemented_re = re.compile(r"raise .*HTTPNotImplemented\(")def check_http_not_implemented(logical_line, physical_line, filename): msg = ("M342: HTTPNotImplemented response must be implemented with" " common raise_feature_not_supported().") if pep8.noqa(physical_line): return if ("magnum/api/openstack/compute" not in filename): return if re.match(http_not_implemented_re, logical_line): yield(0, msg) register(check_http_not_implemented)

commit_message:
Add hacking rule for api_version decorator.

Change-Id: I5a3a9b1c5472c2c6946796ba21b83b14b70a9123
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/magnum refs/changes/17/349017/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: api_version_re = re.compile(r"@.*api_version") decorator_re = re.compile(r"@.*")def check_api_version_decorator(logical_line, previous_logical, blank_before, filename): msg = ("M341: the api_version decorator must be the first decorator" " on a method.") if blank_before == 0 and re.match(api_version_re, logical_line) \ and re.match(decorator_re, previous_logical): yield(0, msg) register(check_api_version_decorator)

commit_message:
K8s: Remove fixed_network name from template

Remove name propertie of fixed_network to allow heat generate a bayname
like private network instead of using "private".

This aligns with other COE(swarm/mesos).

Change-Id: I27d08c33fc6e01750c73457a3d4947e494c7d6ec

commit_message:
Closes-Bug:  #1618291 failed to delete bay in CREATE_IN_PROGRESS

Failed to delete bay which is CREATE_IN_PROGRESS,
the reason is varioussuch as

Resource DELETE failed: ResourceUnknownStatus:
resource s.kube_masters.resources[0].resources.docker_volume_att ach:
Volume detachment failed - Unknown status attaching due to "Unknown"

or

Resource DELETE failed: Conflict: resources.secgroup_kube_master:
Security Group 222b9d66-3473-42c0-8408-61612498ecef in use.
Neutron server returns request_ids:
['req-fb3fce21-5613-466a- 847f-f1cf112b85ec']

Due to the bay in CREATE_IN_PROGRESS deletion operation may cause a lot
of abnormal, so don't support delete the bay in CREATE_IN_PROGRESS.

Change-Id: Ieeb23adbf205ca0da6c2f271750db1ffa86f2348

Ocata: Assessment for networking-calico

Change-Id: I8ed75889e83616b79c291430147373593db2bbda
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-specs refs/changes/07/383907/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ======================== Neutron-vpnaas Scorecard ======================== Neutron integration ------------------- .. _N0: * N0. As a non-starter, does the project use the Neutron REST API or relies on proprietary backends? .. _N1: * N1. Does the project integrate/use neutron-lib? .. _N2: * N2. Does project members actively contribute to help neutron-lib achieve its goal? .. _N3: * N3. Does project members collaborate with the core team to enable subprojects to loosely integrate with the Neutron core platform by helping with the definition of modular interfaces? .. _N4: * N4. How does the project provide networking services? Does it use modular interfaces as provided by the core platform? .. _N5: * N5. If the project provides new API extensions, have API extensions been discussed and accepted by the Neutron drivers team? Please provide links to API specs, if required. Documentation ------------- .. _D1: * D1. Does the project have a doc tox target, functional and continuously working? Provide proof (links to logs.openstack.org). .. _D2: * D2. If the project provide API extensions, does the project have an api-ref tox target, functional and continously working? Provide proof (links to logs.openstack.org). .. _D3: * D3. Does the project have a releasenotes tox target, functional and continously working? Provide proof. .. _D4: * D4. Describe the types of documentation available: developer, end user, administrator, deployer. Continuous Integration ---------------------- .. _C1: * C1. Does the project have a Grafana dashboard showing historical trends of all the jobs available? Provide proof (links to grafana.openstack.org). .. _C2: * C2. Does the project have CI for unit coverage? Provide proof (links to logs.openstack.org) .. _C3: * C3. Does the project have CI for functional coverage? If so, does it include DB migration and sync validation? .. _C4: * C4. Does the project have CI for fullstack coverage? .. _C5: * C5. Does the project have CI for Tempest coverage? If so, specify nature (API and/or Scenario). .. _C6: * C6. Does the project require CI for Grenade coverage? .. _C7: * C7. Does the project provide multinode CI? .. _C8: * C8. Does the project support Python 3.x? Provide proof. Release footprint ----------------- .. _R1: * R1. Does the project adopt semver? .. _R2: * R2. Does the project have release deliverables? Provide proof as available in the `release repo <http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/releases/tree/>`_. Stable backports ---------------- .. _S1: * S1. Does the project have stable branches and/or tags? Provide history of backports. Client library -------------- .. _L1: * L1. If the project requires a client library, how does it implement CLI and API bindings? devstack: enable odl-neutron-logger by default

When odl-neutron-logger is available (from Boron),
enable odl-neutron-logger by default for debugging.

Change-Id: Iccbec823925195fcab520cc010660a68796da20e

commit_message:
Using assertIsNotNone() instead of assertNotEqual(None)

Following OpenStack Style Guidelines[1]:
[H203] Unit test assertions tend to give better messages for more
specific assertions. As a result, assertIsNotNone(...) is preferred
over assertNotEqual(None, ...) and assertIsNot(None, ...)

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#unit-tests-and-assertraises

Change-Id: Iadb27153109b2c4b92df43fc97a5e50eed86f58c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystoneauth refs/changes/21/397521/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.assertIsNotNone(mismatch) self.assertIsNotNone(getattr(mismatch, 'describe', None))

commit_message:
Disable all repos in os-refresh-config too

This change was made for pre-install so it applies during the
image build, but wasn't applied to the os-refresh-config script
that would run after deployment.  The same problems apply there,
so we should do the same thing.

Change-Id: I4b8534cc9586eeb588b5c358550e76e27d40556a
Closes-Bug: 1629922

added_lines: echo "Disabling all previous repos" subscription-manager repos --disable=\*

commit_message:
Cleanup yumdownloader repos

yumdownloader has to have all the repo XML files, etc, which adds up
to a not totally insignificant 150MiB or so.  Currently we're leaking
this directory for every build, which adds up on regualar builders
like nodepool.

Isolate the call with a separate TMPDIR so we can clean it up after
the initial download.

Change-Id: Ic65e8ca837cc76b7a1bb9f83027b4a5bdd270f75
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder refs/changes/21/395921/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: local rc # yumdownloader puts repo xml files and such into a directory # ${TMPDIR}/yum-$USER-random. Since we don't need this once the # initial download happens, redirect TMPDIR for this call so we # can clean it up nicely local temp_tmp temp_tmp=$(mktemp -d) TMPDIR=${temp_tmp} yumdownloader \ --releasever=$DIB_RELEASE \ --setopt=reposdir=$TMP_HOOKS_PATH/yum.repos.d \ --destdir=$WORKING \ ${packages} && rc=$? || rc=$? rm -rf ${temp_tmp} if [[ ${rc} != 0 ]]; then die "Failed to download initial packages: ${packages}" fi

subject: lib: common-functions: Fix tmpfs umounting
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-31 23:32:45.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder/commit/f3b5dec8b2fbdc4dc23867c8510d01c63b19de84', 'message': "lib: common-functions: Fix tmpfs umounting

It has been observed that some chroot operations spawn additional
processes which rely on chroot files. More specifically, zypper, uses
gpg-agent to import and validate gpg keys for its repositories. This
gpg-agent process may stay alive for longer which prevents unmounting of
the tmpfs directory since the gpg-agent process still uses libraries etc
which were present in the chroot. We try to solve this by using lsof to
find out the running processes and kill them gracefully. If lsof is
not available, then we simply wait until unmounting the tmpfs mount point
succeeds in order to not leave any traces behind. The gpg-agent process
usually terminates soon after it's home directory disappears but on fast
systems we can reach the 'umount tmpfs' point before gpg-agent
terminates by itself. The solution is generic enough so other
'chroot processes' can also be handled appropriately.

Change-Id: Iccf332678c79266113e76f062884fc5ee79e515d
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-11-01 00:09:35.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder/commit/777d65de5a112b37ccf854bffe8ca0fd77891e86', 'message': "lib: common-functions: Fix tmpfs umounting

It has been observed that some chroot operations spawn additional
processes which rely on chroot files. More specifically, zypper, uses
gpg-agent to import and validate gpg keys for its repositories. This
gpg-agent process may stay alive for longer which prevents unmounting of
the tmpfs directory since the gpg-agent process still uses libraries etc
which were present in the chroot. We try to solve this by using lsof to
find out the running processes and kill them gracefully. If lsof is
not available, then we simply wait until unmounting the tmpfs mount point
succeeds in order to not leave any traces behind. The gpg-agent process
usually terminates soon after it's home directory disappears but on fast
systems we can reach the 'umount tmpfs' point before gpg-agent
terminates by itself. The solution is generic enough so other
'chroot processes' can also be handled appropriately.

Change-Id: Iccf332678c79266113e76f062884fc5ee79e515d
"}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2016-11-16 15:44:46.000000000', 'files': ['lib/common-functions'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder/commit/a1f57b8cad0717090eb12014d7847a35bd0563a3', 'message': "lib: common-functions: Fix tmpfs umounting

It has been observed that some chroot operations spawn additional
processes which rely on chroot files. More specifically, zypper, uses
gpg-agent to import and validate gpg keys for its repositories. This
gpg-agent process may stay alive for longer which prevents unmounting of
the tmpfs directory since the gpg-agent process still uses libraries etc
which were present in the chroot. We try to solve this by using walking
all the pids in /proc to find out the running processes in the chroot and
kill them gracefully. If that fails for whatever reason, then we simply
keep trying to umount the tmpfs directory before we give up.

The gpg-agent process usually terminates soon after its home directory
disappears but on fast systems we can reach the 'umount tmpfs' point
before gpg-agent terminates by itself. The solution is generic enough so
other 'chroot processes' can also be handled appropriately.

Change-Id: Iccf332678c79266113e76f062884fc5ee79e515d
"}]
commit_message:
lib: common-functions: Fix tmpfs umounting

It has been observed that some chroot operations spawn additional
processes which rely on chroot files. More specifically, zypper, uses
gpg-agent to import and validate gpg keys for its repositories. This
gpg-agent process may stay alive for longer which prevents unmounting of
the tmpfs directory since the gpg-agent process still uses libraries etc
which were present in the chroot. We try to solve this by using walking
all the pids in /proc to find out the running processes in the chroot and
kill them gracefully. If that fails for whatever reason, then we simply
keep trying to umount the tmpfs directory before we give up.

The gpg-agent process usually terminates soon after its home directory
disappears but on fast systems we can reach the 'umount tmpfs' point
before gpg-agent terminates by itself. The solution is generic enough so
other 'chroot processes' can also be handled appropriately.

Change-Id: Iccf332678c79266113e76f062884fc5ee79e515d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder refs/changes/02/392002/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: function kill_chroot_processes () { # Is there another way to find out chroot processes # without relying on the lsof dependency? lsof=$(which lsof 2> /dev/null) if [ -z "${1}" ]; then echo "ERROR: no chroot directory specified" exit 1 fi if [ "$lsof" ]; then for x in $($lsof -t +D "${1}"); do sudo kill $x done fi } kill_chroot_processes $TMP_BUILD_DIR # If kill_chroot_processes did not succeed then we have to wait for # init to reap the orphaned chroot processes if ! timeout 120 sh -c "while ! sudo umount -f $TMP_BUILD_DIR; do sleep 1; done"; then echo "ERROR: failed to umount the $TMP_BUILD_DIR tmpfs mount point" exit 1 fi kill_chroot_processes $TMP_IMAGE_DIR if ! timeout 120 sh -c "while ! sudo umount -f $TMP_IMAGE_DIR; do sleep 1; done"; then echo "ERROR: failed to umount the $TMP_IMAGE_DIR tmpfs mount point" exit 1 fi
deleted_lines: sudo umount -f $TMP_BUILD_DIR || true sudo umount -f $TMP_IMAGE_DIR || true

commit_message:
debian: install dialog package

Without the dialog package is not possible
to properly use an interactive frontend.

debconf will print the following errors:

debconf: unable to initialize frontend: Dialog
debconf: (No usable dialog-like program is installed,
so the dialog based frontend cannot be used. at
/usr/share/perl5/Debconf/FrontEnd/Dialog.pm line 76, <> line 1.)

Change-Id: I0c7142f717cacf7437dbac1e1696f39b00cb4c49
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder refs/changes/18/397218/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: dialog:

commit_message:
Change path for dnf arch override so basearch is not overwritten.

After writing the basearch value to /etc/dnf/vars/basearch the
arch value was overwriting the same file.  This appears to be
incorrect, so changing it to write /etc/dnf/vars/arch, which
matches the subsequent 'yum' code paths.

Change-Id: I5da54f03224c11f9e286f16b68533936c4174c2a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder refs/changes/75/399175/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: echo $arch > /etc/dnf/vars/arch

commit_message:
Support whole disk images in TripleO

Enable to upload whole disk images from the client,
not forcing to upload kernel and initrd images, and
not setting the parameters for those in the glance
qcow2 image.

Change-Id: I9fbac888b3e709212cc6c72153a3ca465101987c
Partially-Implements: blueprint support-full-disk-images
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-tripleoclient refs/changes/26/394426/16 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: parser.add_argument( "--full-image", dest="full_image", action="store_true", default=False, help=_("Image to be uploaded is a full one") if parsed_args.full_image: image_files = [ parsed_args.os_image ] else: image_files = [ '%s.initramfs' % os.environ['AGENT_NAME'], '%s.kernel' % os.environ['AGENT_NAME'], parsed_args.os_image ] # vmlinuz and initrd only need to be uploaded for not full if not parsed_args.full_image: oc_vmlinuz_name = '%s-vmlinuz' % image_name oc_vmlinuz_file = '%s.vmlinuz' % image_name kernel = (self._image_try_update(oc_vmlinuz_name, oc_vmlinuz_file, parsed_args) or self._upload_image( name=oc_vmlinuz_name, is_public=True, disk_format='aki', data=self._read_image_file_pointer( parsed_args.image_path, oc_vmlinuz_file) )) oc_initrd_name = '%s-initrd' % image_name oc_initrd_file = '%s.initrd' % image_name ramdisk = (self._image_try_update(oc_initrd_name, oc_initrd_file, parsed_args) or self._upload_image( name=oc_initrd_name, is_public=True, disk_format='ari', data=self._read_image_file_pointer( parsed_args.image_path, oc_initrd_file) )) properties={'kernel_id': kernel.id, 'ramdisk_id': ramdisk.id} else: properties = {} # qcow2 needs to be uploaded in both cases properties=properties, if not parsed_args.full_image: if (overcloud_image.properties['kernel_id'] != kernel.id or overcloud_image.properties['ramdisk_id'] != ramdisk.id): self.log.error('Link overcloud image to it\'s initrd and kernel' ' images is MISSING OR leads to OLD image.' ' You can keep it or fix it manually.') # kernel and initrd only need to be uploaded for not full if not parsed_args.full_image: deploy_kernel_name = 'bm-deploy-kernel' deploy_kernel_file = '%s.kernel' % os.environ['AGENT_NAME'] self._image_try_update(deploy_kernel_name, deploy_kernel_file, parsed_args) or self._upload_image( name=deploy_kernel_name, is_public=True, disk_format='aki', data=self._read_image_file_pointer( parsed_args.image_path, deploy_kernel_file) ) deploy_ramdisk_name = 'bm-deploy-ramdisk' deploy_ramdisk_file = '%s.initramfs' % os.environ['AGENT_NAME'] self._image_try_update(deploy_ramdisk_name, deploy_ramdisk_file, parsed_args) or self._upload_image( name=deploy_ramdisk_name, is_public=True, disk_format='ari', data=self._read_image_file_pointer(parsed_args.image_path, deploy_ramdisk_file) ) self.log.debug("copy agent images to HTTP BOOT dir") self._file_create_or_update( os.path.join(parsed_args.image_path, '%s.kernel' % os.environ['AGENT_NAME']), os.path.join(parsed_args.http_boot, 'agent.kernel'), parsed_args.update_existing ) self._file_create_or_update( os.path.join(parsed_args.image_path, '%s.initramfs' % os.environ['AGENT_NAME']), os.path.join(parsed_args.http_boot, 'agent.ramdisk'), parsed_args.update_existing )
deleted_lines: image_files = [ '%s.initramfs' % os.environ['AGENT_NAME'], '%s.kernel' % os.environ['AGENT_NAME'], parsed_args.os_image ] oc_vmlinuz_name = '%s-vmlinuz' % image_name oc_vmlinuz_file = '%s.vmlinuz' % image_name kernel = (self._image_try_update(oc_vmlinuz_name, oc_vmlinuz_file, parsed_args) or self._upload_image( name=oc_vmlinuz_name, is_public=True, disk_format='aki', data=self._read_image_file_pointer( parsed_args.image_path, oc_vmlinuz_file) )) oc_initrd_name = '%s-initrd' % image_name oc_initrd_file = '%s.initrd' % image_name ramdisk = (self._image_try_update(oc_initrd_name, oc_initrd_file, parsed_args) or self._upload_image( name=oc_initrd_name, is_public=True, disk_format='ari', data=self._read_image_file_pointer( parsed_args.image_path, oc_initrd_file) )) properties={'kernel_id': kernel.id, 'ramdisk_id': ramdisk.id}, if (overcloud_image.properties['kernel_id'] != kernel.id or overcloud_image.properties['ramdisk_id'] != ramdisk.id): self.log.error('Link overcloud image to it\'s initrd and kernel' ' images is MISSING OR leads to OLD image.' ' You can keep it or fix it manually.') deploy_kernel_name = 'bm-deploy-kernel' deploy_kernel_file = '%s.kernel' % os.environ['AGENT_NAME'] self._image_try_update(deploy_kernel_name, deploy_kernel_file, parsed_args) or self._upload_image( name=deploy_kernel_name, is_public=True, disk_format='aki', data=self._read_image_file_pointer( parsed_args.image_path, deploy_kernel_file) ) deploy_ramdisk_name = 'bm-deploy-ramdisk' deploy_ramdisk_file = '%s.initramfs' % os.environ['AGENT_NAME'] self._image_try_update(deploy_ramdisk_name, deploy_ramdisk_file, parsed_args) or self._upload_image( name=deploy_ramdisk_name, is_public=True, disk_format='ari', data=self._read_image_file_pointer(parsed_args.image_path, deploy_ramdisk_file) ) self.log.debug("copy agent images to HTTP BOOT dir") self._file_create_or_update( os.path.join(parsed_args.image_path, '%s.kernel' % os.environ['AGENT_NAME']), os.path.join(parsed_args.http_boot, 'agent.kernel'), parsed_args.update_existing ) self._file_create_or_update( os.path.join(parsed_args.image_path, '%s.initramfs' % os.environ['AGENT_NAME']), os.path.join(parsed_args.http_boot, 'agent.ramdisk'), parsed_args.update_existing )

commit_message:
Remove old authtoken options

Since we are in ocata lets remove all old parameters in api
to configure the keystone_authtoken section

Change-Id: I773852cadc4369dab2ecbce1c643e8f6febc67d2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-nova refs/changes/53/394753/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if is_service_default($password) { keystone::resource::authtoken { 'nova_config': username => $username, password => $password, project_name => $project_name, auth_url => $auth_url, auth_uri => $auth_uri, auth_version => $auth_version, memcached_servers => $memcached_servers,
deleted_lines: if is_service_default($password) and ! $::nova::api::admin_password { $username_real = pick($::nova::api::admin_user, $username) $password_real = pick($::nova::api::admin_password, $password) $project_name_real = pick($::nova::api::admin_tenant_name, $project_name) $auth_uri_real = pick($::nova::api::auth_uri, $auth_uri) $auth_version_real = pick($::nova::api::auth_version, $auth_version) $memcached_servers_real = pick($::nova::memcached_servers, $memcached_servers) $auth_url_real = pick($::nova::api::identity_uri, $auth_url) keystone::resource::authtoken { 'nova_config': username => $username_real, password => $password_real, project_name => $project_name_real, auth_url => $auth_url_real, auth_uri => $auth_uri_real, auth_version => $auth_version_real, memcached_servers => $memcached_servers_real,

commit_message:
Check ceph backend connection on driver setup

Check that ceph connection really works when setting up
the driver instead of doing real connect later in init_host
phase. This mitigates the risk that the service crashes/respawns
in an infinite loop because of a connection error.

Change-Id: Ia71b55dab1535ce351310108aaf53304b15ab757
Closes-Bug: 1640169
(cherry picked from commit af79b9f5b78be5413bc363cbf12ae8351b9e4f02)

commit_message:
deprecate the entire library

the library is essentially unmaintained, no tests have been added
since it's inception 1.5 years ago.

we can move the functionality to django_openstack_auth proper
using extras, or attic the entire library if no one is using it.
either way, this is a step toward both of those outcomes.

Change-Id: I5e2cf2852e89586415ddbe8da022f7461b3ba0d6
Closes-Bug: 1584432

commit_message:
Reinitialize venv upon install

Reinitializes (copies python, etc binaries) into the venv when
dropping a new venv into place. This is needed because the Python
binary packaged with the venv may not match the Python running on
the host it is being installed to. (ie. in the case of a Xenial
repo container and a Trusty target host.)

Change-Id: I22dca862f88c38c15ca95b117a73f3368219b3cd
Partial-Bug: #1637509
(cherry picked from commit e7bcb312a881a0946957fcd1e3e65ca72b8952a7)

commit_message:
Add optional kerberos support

This commit adds support for optional kerberos based auth. It
copies the already existing django-openstack-auth plugin and
documenation at [1]. It also adds in checks to ensure the plugin
is not loaded when the library is not available.

The plugin can be optionally installed by running:

  pip install django_openstack_auth[kerberos]

Sadly there were no to copy along with the code.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/django-openstack-auth-kerberos

Change-Id: I2da055834b462e24e81f38cd61d6a19b12b28a80
Closes-Bug: 1584432

added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); # you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. # You may obtain a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, # WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or # implied. # See the License for the specific language governing permissions and # limitations under the License. import logging import time from django.conf import settings from django.contrib import auth from django import http as django_http from django import shortcuts from django.views.decorators.cache import never_cache # noqa from django.views.decorators.csrf import csrf_exempt # noqa from django.views.decorators.csrf import csrf_protect # noqa from django.views.decorators.debug import sensitive_post_parameters # noqa # This is historic and is added back in to not break older versions of # Horizon, fix to Horizon to remove this requirement was committed in # Juno from openstack_auth import user as auth_user LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) @sensitive_post_parameters() @csrf_exempt @never_cache def kerberos_login(request): """Attempt to log a user in via kerberos credential.""" user = auth.authenticate(request=request) if user and user.is_authenticated(): auth.login(request, user) res = shortcuts.redirect(settings.LOGIN_REDIRECT_URL) auth_user.set_session_from_user(request, user) request.session['last_activity'] = int(time.time()) else: # NOTE(jamielennox): If horizon is configured correctly this would # imply that you got a kerberos ticket however you couldn't be logged # into keystone. Not much we can do here, throw a 401 so that apache # will trigger a redirect to form login. res = django_http.HttpResponse('Unauthorized', status=401) return res

commit_message:
Add freezerclient to global requirements

The python-freezerclient is a OpenStack client for Freezer.
It provides a Python API and a command-line tool (freezer).

For new Requirements Q&A:
[Q] Is the library actively maintained?
[A] Yes. You can see activity log here: http://stackalytics.com/report/activity?module=python-freezerclient&project_type=openstack&release=all

[Q] Is the library good code?
[A] Yes. OpenStack Style Guidelines is supported.

[Q] Is the library python 3 compatible?
[A] Sure. The code is tested against python 3.

[Q] Is the library license compatible?
[A] Yes, the Apache License 2.0

[Q] Is the library already packaged in the distros we target (Ubuntu latest / Fedora latest)?
[A] Nope.

[Q] Is the function of this library already covered by other libraries in global-requirements.txt?
[A] No.

[Q] Is the library required for OpenStack project or related dev or infrastructure setup?
[A] Yes, of course. It required for using in freezer related projects.
    BP for freezer: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/freezer/+spec/switch-to-python-freezer-client
    Gerrit Change-ID: I2627a5326c8ad4acc96177605f0250925748fb67

Change-Id: Ie108d99d56ca76614cdf6927f614a44106a0a922

commit_message:
Remove entry_points to non-existent drivers

The setup.cfg for stevedore still contains references to the
memcache token persistence drivers even though those drivers were
removed in commit I4b8b88409abe8eea8f0a075aebbe9c569367c454.

bp removed-as-of-ocata

Change-Id: Iaaa3c5bc6d88ee45bef956a437e0fd711313be6b

commit_message:
Added support for a stop playbook in kolla

Behavior of stop playbook is very similar to the destroy
playbook.  This is meant when you may just want to bring down
the service for some sort of maintenance but not destroy all
the associated data. Also added support for the new playbook
into the kolla-ansible command.

Change-Id: Icf0ca91de71dc8ead3a024de3e5b9e49116560d1
Implements: blueprint ansible-stop-host-playbook

commit_message:
Reinitialize venv upon install

Reinitializes (copies python, etc binaries) into the venv when
dropping a new venv into place. This is needed because the Python
binary packaged with the venv may not match the Python running on
the host it is being installed to. (ie. in the case of a Xenial
repo container and a Trusty target host.)

Change-Id: Ib24917cf63cf0e6c7ffaf48dae15b0733b48cd04
Partial-Bug: #1637509
(cherry picked from commit 68fd798f31a8d917f38dbeb9c3d3fc5327e175bf)

commit_message:
Deleting duplicate code

devstack/lib/barbican and bin/keystone_data.sh both
contain code to setup keystone for functional tests.
There is duplicate code between them that makes
maintenance and enhancements difficult.

devstack/lib/barbican contains function named
"create_barbican_accounts" which runs the same setup
compared to bin/keystone_data.sh. Also, devstack/lib/
barbican used OpenStack client compared to
bin/keystone_data.sh which uses Keystone CLI.

There is no invocation of bin/keystone_data.sh in
barbican and hence removing dead code.

Change-Id: If9cadf2eeaa4225451cf8001f409268317b0666e

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/45/398745/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: ==================== Specialized hardware ==================== Certain workloads require specialized hardware devices that have significant virtualization or sharing challenges. Applications such as load balancers, highly parallel brute force computing, and direct to wire networking may need capabilities that basic OpenStack components do not provide. Challenges ~~~~~~~~~~ Some applications need access to hardware devices to either improve performance or provide capabilities that are not virtual CPU, RAM, network, or storage. These can be a shared resource, such as a cryptography processor, or a dedicated resource, such as a Graphics Processing Unit (GPU). OpenStack can provide some of these, while others may need extra work. Solutions ~~~~~~~~~ To provide cryptography offloading to a set of instances, you can use Image service configuration options. For example, assign the cryptography chip to a device node in the guest. For further information on this configuration, see `Image service property keys <http://docs.openstack.org/cli-reference/glance-property- keys.html>`_. However, this option allows all guests using the configured images to access the hypervisor cryptography device. If you require direct access to a specific device, PCI pass-through enables you to dedicate the device to a single instance per hypervisor. You must define a flavor that has the PCI device specifically in order to properly schedule instances. More information regarding PCI pass-through, including instructions for implementing and using it, is available at `https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Pci_passthrough <https://wiki.openstack.org/ wiki/Pci_passthrough#How_to_check_PCI_status_with_PCI_api_patches>`_. .. figure:: ../figures/Specialized_Hardware2.png :width: 100%

commit_message:
Add DEVSTACK_SUBNODE_CONFIG for multinode

Current config uses DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG for
multinode jobs, which results in exporoting
two different set of enabled services for
subnodes

commit_message:
Update metadata proxy when subnet add/delete

With current code, if first subnet of the network is an ipv6 subnet,
the metadata proxy will not be spawned. If user then adds ipv4 subnet
with dhcp enabled, the metadata proxy will still not be spawned. As a
result, the metadata service will not be available for the network.

This patch will kill/spawn metadata proxy,  when subnet add/delete.
So, even if the first subnet of the network is not an ipv4 subnet with
dhcp enabled, the metadata proxy can still be spawned if network has
subnets need metadata proxy.

Closes-bug: #1556991

Conflicts:
	neutron/tests/functional/agent/test_dhcp_agent.py

Change-Id: I0b45af8f2b756732f45c13d7e2dbcd30653cc026
(cherry picked from commit 784864d1785bcd32297865cae5a7a243b05ed30d)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/71/395571/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Only ipv4 subnet, with dhcp enabled, will use metadata proxy. return any(s for s in network.subnets if s.ip_version == 4 and s.enable_dhcp) # Only ipv4 isolated subnet, which has dhcp enabled, will use # metadata proxy. return any(isolated_subnets[s.id] for s in network.subnets if s.ip_version == 4 and s.enable_dhcp)
deleted_lines: return True return any(isolated_subnets[subnet.id] for subnet in network.subnets)

commit_message:
Remove ClusteredComputeManager

This is marked for removal in Ocata, and its continued existence
necessitates the need for the 'compute_manager' option in nova.
Simply remove this legacy code.

Change-Id: I93b62372e357db4f7c39992c244b2ec9e594ad9c
Implements: bp ironic-multiple-compute-hosts
Closes-Bug: #1464769
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/62/397762/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: # coding=utf-8 # # Copyright 2014 Red Hat, Inc. # Copyright 2013 Hewlett-Packard Development Company, L.P. # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. """Short term workaround for friction in the Nova compute manager with Ironic. https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/ironic-nova-friction contains current design work. The goal here is to generalise the areas where n-c talking to a clustered hypervisor has issues, and long term fold them into the main ComputeManager. """ from oslo_concurrency import lockutils from oslo_log import log as logging from nova.compute import manager import nova.context from nova.i18n import _LW LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) CCM_SEMAPHORE = 'clustered_compute_manager' # TODO(jroll) delete this in Ocata class ClusteredComputeManager(manager.ComputeManager): def __init__(self, *args, **kwargs): LOG.warning(_LW('ClusteredComputeManager is deprecated. As of the ' 'Newton release of Nova, the ironic ' 'virt driver directly supports using multiple ' 'compute hosts without ClusteredComputeManager. ' 'Users should unset the `compute_manager` ' 'configuration option to use Nova\'s default ' 'instead. ClusteredComputeManager will be removed ' 'during the Ocata cycle.')) super(ClusteredComputeManager, self).__init__(*args, **kwargs) def init_host(self): """Initialization for a clustered compute service.""" self.driver.init_host(host=self.host) # Not used currently. # context = nova.context.get_admin_context() # instances = instance_obj.InstanceList.get_by_host( # context, self.host, expected_attrs=['info_cache']) # defer_iptables_apply is moot for clusters - no local iptables # if CONF.defer_iptables_apply: # self.driver.filter_defer_apply_on() self.init_virt_events() # try: # evacuation is moot for a clustered hypervisor # # checking that instance was not already evacuated to other host # self._destroy_evacuated_instances(context) # Don't run _init_instance until we solve the partitioning problem # - with N n-cpu's all claiming the same hostname, running # _init_instance here would lead to race conditions where each runs # _init_instance concurrently. # for instance in instances: # self._init_instance(context, instance) # finally: # defer_iptables_apply is moot for clusters - no local iptables # if CONF.defer_iptables_apply: # self.driver.filter_defer_apply_off() def pre_start_hook(self): """Update our available resources After the service is initialized, but before we fully bring the service up by listening on RPC queues, make sure to update our available resources (and indirectly our available nodes). """ # This is an optimisation to immediately advertise resources but # the periodic task will update them eventually anyway, so ignore # errors as they may be transient (e.g. the scheduler isn't # available...). XXX(lifeless) this applies to all ComputeManagers # and once I feature freeze is over we should push that to nova # directly. try: self.update_available_resource(nova.context.get_admin_context()) except Exception: pass @lockutils.synchronized(CCM_SEMAPHORE, 'ironic-') def _update_resources(self, node_uuid): """Update the specified node resource Updates the resources for instance while protecting against a race on self._resource_tracker_dict. :param node_uuid: UUID of the Ironic node to update resources for. """ self.update_available_resource_for_node( nova.context.get_admin_context(), node_uuid) def terminate_instance(self, context, instance, bdms, reservations): """Terminate an instance on a node. We override this method and force a post-termination update to Nova's resources. This avoids having to wait for a Nova periodic task tick before nodes can be reused. """ super(ClusteredComputeManager, self).terminate_instance(context, instance, bdms, reservations) self._update_resources(instance.node)

subject: Devmode: reposition convert and update
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-16 00:19:24.000000000', 'files': ['roles/libvirt/setup/undercloud/tasks/convert_image.yml', 'roles/libvirt/setup/undercloud/tasks/main.yml', 'roles/libvirt/setup/undercloud/tasks/update_image.yml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart/commit/0b41145b760a915ffd0985c757e91a14cea3c767', 'message': "Devmode: reposition convert and update

- put update after convert
  since update is made different for undercloud and overcloud images,
  having update before convert, doesn't actually update the undercloud
  image in the correct way
- up injection at the end of update
  now that update is after convert, the image injection must be launched
  at the end of update, so updated overcloud images are actually
  injected in undercloud

Change-Id: Ic7001f8bcac5b43031dee44b3b4c8093f7772db2
"}]
commit_message:
Devmode: reposition convert and update

- put update after convert
  since update is made different for undercloud and overcloud images,
  having update before convert, doesn't actually update the undercloud
  image in the correct way
- up injection at the end of update
  now that update is after convert, the image injection must be launched
  at the end of update, so updated overcloud images are actually
  injected in undercloud

Change-Id: Ic7001f8bcac5b43031dee44b3b4c8093f7772db2

commit_message:
Nova: Limit stable/newton to Trusty based grenade jobs

This is required as stable/mitaka devstack does not support Xenial and
will cause the grenade job to fail during the initial install.

Change-Id: I06e7d65256c6a82854b733142cdb961ebe1525f9
Closes-bug: #1642543
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/20/398920/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: # NOTE(mriedem): This job uses xenial nodes which restricts it to >= newton # changes. It also uses nova-network which is deprecated and not the default # in Ocata so we need to just restrict it to running on stable/newton - name: gate-grenade-dsvm-ubuntu-xenial

commit_message:
Ocata-1 releases for TripleO components

This prepares initial releases for all TripleO components except
tripleo-quickstart (there is some discussion re moving this to
an independent release model as we don't have stable branches
for that because it's a bootstrapping tool, not an end user deliverable)

Note also that I've aligned the puppet-tripleo release naming with the
puppet openstack convention of a number of releases during the
cycle despite being cycle-trailing, but other tripleo components
adopt the 6.0.0.0b1 naming where we're tracking features/bugs
associated with each milestone e.g ref

https://launchpad.net/tripleo/+milestone/ocata-1

Change-Id: I890de6587efcc1ce3d93edcf8dc24e77f67b0d03

commit_message:
Headers now use a case incensitive dictionary

_prep_headers_to_info currently converts all header data to lowercase.
This fix sends all header info as a case insensitive dictionary,
HeaderKeyDict() to avoid having to normalize case.
Currently sends all headers as strings. More work may be needed
if it's better to send numbers as ints, not strings.
Fixes several unit tests that expect integers instead of strings.

Closes-Bug: 1537879

Change-Id: Iec70cb9a266820c82290ad38e5cc18a313ebc7ec

commit_message:
Don't include openstack/common in flake8 exclude list

The directory openstack/common was used to keep codes from
oslo-incubator, we have retired oslo-incubator in following patch
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/297487/
so don't use this directory any more.

Change-Id: I1bbdfdcc9c9b89ad65b91fd86a81148a3cf0d508
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/instack refs/changes/16/398216/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: exclude=.venv,.git,.tox,dist,doc,*lib/python*,*egg,build

commit_message:
In disk-image-create, append to INSTALL_PACKAGES instead of clobbering.

This allows -p <packagelist> to be used multiple times.

Change-Id: Iabe43982e1606c7ca963a1dd3b23ba47d148ae38
Closes-Bug: #1641157
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder refs/changes/02/396702/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: echo " -p package[,package,package] -- list of packages to install in the image. If specified multiple times the packages are appended to the list." -p) IFS="," read -a _INSTALL_PACKAGES <<< "$2"; export INSTALL_PACKAGES=( ${INSTALL_PACKAGES[@]} ${_INSTALL_PACKAGES[@]} ) ; shift 2 ;;
deleted_lines: echo " -p package[,package,package] -- list of packages to install in the image" -p) IFS="," read -a INSTALL_PACKAGES <<< "$2"; export INSTALL_PACKAGES ; shift 2 ;;

subject: Fix pypy soabi tests
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-18 08:14:26.000000000', 'files': ['pbr/tests/test_packaging.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/pbr/commit/d529e2b2a2462687035318f6ed38467434aec6e8', 'message': 'Fix pypy soabi tests

Xenial PyPy adds multiarch to the compiled c library, so if PyPy reports
multiarch we add it to the soabi string.

If the installed PyPy is not configured for multiarch, the multiarch
config variable will not exist and `arch` will be None, in which case we
should only update the string if multiarch exists.

Change-Id: Idcd3af4878d5b66c6770f96e7235a7d2f848df81
'}]
commit_message:
Fix pypy soabi tests

Xenial PyPy adds multiarch to the compiled c library, so if PyPy reports
multiarch we add it to the soabi string.

If the installed PyPy is not configured for multiarch, the multiarch
config variable will not exist and `arch` will be None, in which case we
should only update the string if multiarch exists.

Change-Id: Idcd3af4878d5b66c6770f96e7235a7d2f848df81
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/pbr refs/changes/89/343489/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: arch = sysconfig.get_config_var('MULTIARCH') if soabi and arch and 'pypy' in sysconfig.get_scheme_names(): soabi = '%s-%s' % (soabi, arch)

commit_message:
Make murano-dashboard using horizon's DATABASE when horizon configured

If horizon config DATABASES, let murano-dashboard using horizon's config,
if not, will set it by murano.

Closes-bug: #1642152
Change-Id: I65c599945754b92be681058611ec9162c6606f14
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/murano-dashboard refs/changes/52/398152/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Make sure horizon has config the DATABASES, If horizon config use horizon's # DATABASES, if not, set it by murano. try: from openstack_dashboard.settings import DATABASES if DATABASES.has_key('default'): DATABASES_CONFIG = True else: DATABASES_CONFIG = False except ImportError: DATABASES_CONFIG = False if not DATABASES_CONFIG: DATABASES = { 'default': { 'ENGINE': 'django.db.backends.sqlite3', 'NAME': 'murano-dashboard.sqlite', } }

commit_message:
Refactor inventory generation load/save filesystem

Segmenting the storage-related operations from the rest of the
inventory generation management tooling, in support of better
maintainability testability and future support for alternate storage
options.

Operations in manage.py are slightly updated to make use of common
code.

Change-Id: If032bcc9e4727d3895e4ef6cecb6aff511d4b0af
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/17/392417/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import filesystem as fs get_backup_name_path = 'filesystem.get_backup_name' with mock.patch('filesystem.tarfile.open') as tar_open: fs.make_backup(TARGET_DIR, inventory_file_path) inv = fs.load_inventory(TARGET_DIR) self.inv = fs.load_inventory(TARGET_DIR, di.INVENTORY_SKEL) # NOTE: No info messages are published when debug is False
deleted_lines: get_backup_name_path = 'generate.get_backup_name' with mock.patch('generate.tarfile.open') as tar_open: di.make_backup(TARGET_DIR, inventory_file_path) inventory_file_path = os.path.join(TARGET_DIR, 'openstack_inventory.json') inv = di.get_inventory(TARGET_DIR, inventory_file_path) self.inv = di.get_inventory(TARGET_DIR, '') self.assertTrue(mock_logger.info.called)

commit_message:
Add prep-for-network-aware-scheduling-ocata spec

Change how we talk to neutron to allow us in the future to implement
network aware scheduling.

This is just the continuation of the work started during newton.

This is a priority, because this blocks routed networks, which is
blocking the removal of cells v1.

blueprint prep-for-network-aware-scheduling-ocata

Change-Id: Id28509c7fae784ecc6359556a6da1bc39f2b68f7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/88/393888/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ============================================== Prep work for Network aware scheduling (Ocata) ============================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/prep-for-network-aware-scheduling-ocata Change how we talk to neutron to allow us in the future to implement network aware scheduling. This continues on from the work started in Newton: http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/newton/implemented/prep-for-network-aware-scheduling.html Problem description =================== Some IP subnets can be restricted to a subset of hosts, due to an operators network configuration. In this environment, it means you could build somewhere that has no public IPs available. This is being added into Neutron by the Routed Networks feature. To make this possible, we need to know the details of all the user's requested ports, and what resources are required, before asking the scheduler for a host. In addition, after picking a location, we should check that there is an IP available before continuing with the rest of the build process. As an aside, the allocate_for_instance call currently contains both parts of that operation and has proved very difficult to maintain and evolve. In newton, we changed the code to separate the update and create operations, so we are now able to look at moving where those operations happen. Use Cases --------- This is largely a code refactor. Proposed change =============== In newton we have changed the code inside allocate_for_instance into clear get/create and update phase. We need to complete the split, by ensuring the network info cache contains all the info required to be shared between the two phases of the operation. Second, we want to move the get/create ports before the scheduler is called. In terms of upgrades, we need to ensure old compute nodes don't re-create ports that the scheduler has already created. Similarly, when deleting an instance, the old node should correctly know which ports were created by Nova and can be deleted. For nova-network users, the get/create ports can be a noop. The third step is to move the port update into the conductor, right after the scheduler has picked an appropriate host. We will not be able to run this code until all compute nodes have been upgraded to the newest version. Until all nodes have been upgraded, the new nodes will still have to run this code on the Compute node. While annoying, this move is only to help with faster retries, and as such, should not block any progress. Note this port update step includes setting the host on the port, and in the future will be the point an IP is assigned, if the port does not yet have an IP. For nova-network, we can run the existing allocate-for-instance logic in the conductor, after the scheduler is called. For cells v1 users, this should correctly be in the child cell conductor. For cells v2 users, it doesn't matter that this is in the api conductor. Alternatives ------------ We could attempt to add more complexity into the existing allocate_for_instance code. But history has shown that is likely to create many regressions. Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- None Security impact --------------- Eventually it could mean we don't need any neutron related credentials on any of the compute nodes. This work will not achieve that goal, but it is a step in the right direction. Notifications impact -------------------- Notifications may now have a different host and service, but they should be otherwise identical. Other end user impact --------------------- None Performance Impact ------------------ Currently the neutron port binding is done in parallel with other long running tasks that the compute node performs during the boot process. This moves the port creation and binding into the critical path of the boot process. When Nova is creating ports for users, instead of just calling port create with all the parameters, will now first create the port and later update the port. This will slightly increase the load on the Neutron API during the boot process. However this should be minimal, as we are not duplicating any of the expensive parts of the process, such as port binding and IP allocation. This also generally moves more load into the nova-conductor nodes, but on the upside this reduces the load on the nova-compute nodes. Other deployer impact --------------------- We will need the neutron credentials on nova-conductor, which may not currently have been happening. Developer impact ---------------- Improved ability to understand allocate_for_instance, and its replacements. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: John Garbutt (IRC: johnthetubaguy) Work Items ---------- * Split allocate_for_instance into two functions * Move create/get port call into the conductor, before calling the scheduler, such that allocate_for_instance no longer creates ports, no op for nova-net. This is likely to be achieved by adding a new method into the network API for both neutron and nova-net. * Move the remainder of allocate_for_instance call into conductor, for both nova-net and neutron Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= Grenade + neutron should cover this well. Documentation Impact ==================== None References ========== None History ======= .. list-table:: Revisions :header-rows: 1 * - Release Name - Description * - Newton - Introduced * - Ocata - Continued

commit_message:
Configure AIO sources.list with first matched repo

The bootstrap-aio role reconfigures sources.list by greping for a
pattern in the existing sources.list file. From the results of the
grep, register the base and security repos with the first stdout_line
instead of the entirety of stdout to avoid unexpected newlines and
additional repo URLs.

Closes-Bug: 1638878
Change-Id: I64e79701c3ecc62ddec5e7ed86501ca3a94d8f3d
(cherry picked from commit f9bd7ab67923c7964344e30cf736aa99cb0fd200)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/28/399128/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: bootstrap_host_ubuntu_repo: "{{ ubuntu_repo.stdout_lines[0] }}" bootstrap_host_ubuntu_security_repo: "{{ ubuntu_security_repo.stdout_lines[0] }}"

commit_message:
Don't use ssh-keygen -A for init scripts

We are running into race conditions with glean, which ssh-keygen -A is
not handling properly.  So, create a new script to first check if the
file exists, then use 'yes' to disable overwriting of existing files.

Change-Id: Ie82e1e3f832fcc8f32c7e1335c5f0ee16d36f9a8
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder refs/changes/85/378985/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ExecStart=/usr/bin/yes n | /usr/bin/ssh-keygen -A

commit_message:
Don't include openstack/common in flake8 exclude list

The directory openstack/common was used to keep codes from
oslo-incubator, we have retired oslo-incubator in following patch
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/297487/
so don't use this directory any more.

Change-Id: Ia43e287699c82e15c38f229a8e39d1a366cc506c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon-cisco-ui refs/changes/08/398208/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: exclude = .venv,.git,.tox,dist,*lib/python*,*egg,build,panel_template,dash_template,local_settings.py,*/local/*,*/test/test_plugins/*,.ropeproject

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-10 06:49:00.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/4a97c013bd564d6d8ee45d4ea28f3504acdd22ad', 'message': "Fix ML2, base db plugin update_subnet for transactions

This refactors the DB base plugin to add a precommit hook
that core plugins can override to inject logic that should
occur before the subnet is committed to the DB.

This allows the ML2 plugin to leverage that hook and avoid
starting a transaction before calling update_subnet on the
base plugin. This is important because the update_subnet
method in the base plugin performs operations that shouldn't
be inside of an uncommited transaction, such as updating
ports, generating AMQP notifications, and generating
AFTER_UPDATE callback events.

This is also necessary for the facade and push-notification
switch because ongoing db sessions will not be used for
core methods and notification generation.

Change-Id: Ib825a9e0c0c6693a4e708ae6ce362775c70d843d
Related-Bug: #1540844
Partially-Implements: blueprint push-notifications
Partially-Implements: blueprint enginefacade-switch

commit_message:
Fix ML2, base db plugin update_subnet for transactions

This refactors the DB base plugin update_subnet method into
precommit and postcommit methods so a core plugin can avoid
executing the postcommit methods while it has an open
transaction. Backwards compatibility is preserved for plugins
which do not need this.

This is important because the update_subnet method in the
base plugin performs operations that shouldn't be inside
of an uncommited transaction, such as updating ports,
generating AMQP notifications, and generating AFTER_UPDATE
callback events. Until this patch, ML2 was performing the
entire base plugin update_subnet operation in a transaction.

This is also necessary for the facade and push-notification
switch because ongoing db sessions will not be used for
core methods and notification generation.

Related-Bug: #1540844
Partially-Implements: blueprint push-notifications
Partially-Implements: blueprint enginefacade-switch
Change-Id: Ib825a9e0c0c6693a4e708ae6ce362775c70d843d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/72/395972/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _update_subnet_precommit(self, context, orig, body, result, subnet): self.extension_manager.process_update_subnet( context, body, result) # expire subnet object since extensions may have modified relationships context.session.expire(subnet) updated_subnet = self.get_subnet(context, id) network = self.get_network(context, updated_subnet['network_id']) mech_context = driver_context.SubnetContext( self, context, updated_subnet, network, original_subnet=orig) self.mechanism_manager.update_subnet_precommit(mech_context) updated_subnet, original_subnet = self.update_subnet_return_orig( context, id, subnet) network = self.get_network(context, updated_subnet['network_id']) mech_context = driver_context.SubnetContext( self, context, updated_subnet, network, original_subnet=original_subnet)
deleted_lines: with session.begin(subtransactions=True): original_subnet = super(Ml2Plugin, self).get_subnet(context, id) updated_subnet = super(Ml2Plugin, self).update_subnet( context, id, subnet) self.extension_manager.process_update_subnet( context, subnet[attributes.SUBNET], updated_subnet) updated_subnet = self.get_subnet(context, id) network = self.get_network(context, updated_subnet['network_id']) mech_context = driver_context.SubnetContext( self, context, updated_subnet, network, original_subnet=original_subnet) self.mechanism_manager.update_subnet_precommit(mech_context)

commit_message:
neutron: move xenial rally job into check queue

Since there are no visible issues with the job, and it immediately
passed on the very first experimental check in neutron master, I suggest
we just replace the existing trusty job with it, making the latter
voting without the usual time to collect statistics.

If you wonder why the job is in check queue only, it reflects the
current setup for trusty flavour.

This patch still keeps trusty job flavour for Mitaka and earlier.

Change-Id: Iecb6d063cd99257b1d5f640943c743a207fce51f

subject: return unique meter list for Resource Usage pannel
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-31 13:36:48.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/api/ceilometer.py', 'openstack_dashboard/test/api_tests/ceilometer_tests.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/795617c249e16d4cdbe8400807e5cad6a2a15594', 'message': "return unique meter list for Resource Usage pannel

Ceilometer list meter API will only return limited number of meters
by default to 100, and meters can have duplicate name because they may
associated to various resources. So Resource Usage pannel usually
cannot display correct meter list.

Besides, Ceilometer now supports to only return unique meter name,
without resource information, and we can get benifit from this
parameter to reduce response time and less network data.

This patch always sets unique parameter to True, which will
help to display the correct meter list. But leave limit parameter
untouched, we can add a config option in future, or just hard code
it to a very large number, in case there are many meters enabled
in user's environment.

Change-Id: I63393fcce5463fd1a69b314bd858986589c793ae
Closes-Bug: #1585532
"}]
commit_message:
return unique meter list for Resource Usage pannel

Ceilometer list meter API will only return limited number of meters
by default to 100, and meters can have duplicate name because they may
associated to various resources. So Resource Usage pannel usually
cannot display correct meter list.

Besides, Ceilometer now supports to only return unique meter name,
without resource information, and we can get benifit from this
parameter to reduce response time and less network data.

This patch always sets unique parameter to True, which will
help to display the correct meter list. But leave limit parameter
untouched, we can add a config option in future, or just hard code
it to a very large number, in case there are many meters enabled
in user's environment.

Change-Id: I63393fcce5463fd1a69b314bd858986589c793ae
Closes-Bug: #1585532

commit_message:
Assert keystone supports rolling upgrades

As of the Newton release, keystone supports rolling upgrades as
documented here:

  http://docs.openstack.org/developer/keystone/upgrading.html#upgrading-without-downtime

Change-Id: Iad9c339657df3b1f14b9b3a681c1e65a603c9c05

commit_message:
Add plurals management

Add functions for mapping from plural to singular and vice-versa.  This
will allow projects, including neutron and neutron-fwaas, to manage
their plurals in a common manner, rather than addressing the PLURALS
dict.

Prior to this change, PLURALS is used in extension definitons in
neutron-fwaas, neutron-lbaas, neutron-fwaas, networking-midonet,
tap-as-a-service, and neutron-dynamic-routing, among others.

Change-Id: I3f69e083afeb30f6c338e4569674edd068db3236

added_lines: _PLURALS = {} def add_plural(singular, plural): """Add a plural to the plural lookup dict :param singular: Singular form of the noun :param plural: Plural form of the noun """ _PLURALS.update({singular: plural}) def add_plurals(plural_dict): """Add dict of plurals to plural lookup dict :param plural_dict: A dict containing mappings of singular to plural, with singular as the key. """ return _PLURALS.update(plural_dict) def get_plural(singular): """Given the singular form of a word, fetch the plural :param singular: Singular form of the noun. :returns: String containing the plural form of the noun. """ return _PLURALS[singular] def get_singular(plural): """Given the plural form of a word, fetch the singular :param plural: Plural form of the noun. :returns: String containing the singular form of the noun. """ for my_singular, my_plural in _PLURALS.items(): if my_plural == plural: return my_singular

commit_message:
Set a default for upper_constraints_check.status

On occasion the Ansible URI module may not return
a status key, so this patch ensures that even if
it doesn't there will still be a value of '503'
which translates into a 'Service Unavailable'
error.

Change-Id: Ie944152f56bd5c68cfd80d406cf4175e9723c8f6
(cherry picked from commit 2fe22673612a983dbd9e00b9c74e5d737412987c)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/42/398842/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: when: (upper_constraints_check.status | default(503)) != 200
